mpkorstanje
2017-08-30 04:32:18

@Aslak Helles√∏y if cucumber-expressions are at java 7. Then cucumber-jvm can also go to java 7 (still at 1.6) at the moment.

mpkorstanje
2017-08-30 04:34:50

mpkorstanje
2017-08-30 04:38:47

Not sure how 1.7 and android work together at all.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-08-30 05:09:59

I think Java 7 is ok - I guess the build will tell us if it isn't?

mpkorstanje
2017-09-02 08:11:16

Kinda. I don't have enough android knowledge to form an opinion

mpkorstanje
2017-09-02 09:49:45

Regarding xstream, with cucumber expressions it becomes almost obsolete. The rework will increase the effort to upgrade though.

I think it be best to remove it all together. Then patch it back in as an extension for se/deserializing tables and a thingy that makes using the new type registry with the old xstreams stuff easy.

Having the xstream thing in its own jar should also give telemetry into its use.

brasmusson
2017-09-03 11:45:27

Preferably, we need to find out from which Android SDK version and ABI version that Java 7 is ok. In case of Java 8 (bytecode version 52), it is the dex compiler that fails (that is at build time). But IIRC when the Android module was first added to Cucumber-JVM (and it still need the Android SDK to build), it specified that the minimum ABI-version as 8 (or something), however the core module used the method String.emtpy which even though it was part of Java 6, it still was not implemented in the Dalvik library, a later ABI-version was actually needed. Then it was an exception thrown at runtime. It looks that it is possible that even though our Travis build passes, there still could be some code paths not exercised by the Travis build that could generate runtime exceptions.

mpkorstanje
2017-09-05 14:30:38

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1215 Should warrant a patch release.

GitHub
Scenario.isFailed always return false ¬∑ Issue #1215 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-jvm
Summary Since Cucumber JVM 2.0.0, Scenario.getStatus() returns an enum and Scenario.isFailed() has not been updated, which means it always return false. Expected Behavior When a scenario is failed,...
Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-09-05 16:11:49

Yep agree. Ouch! Could we wrap a test around this bug to prevent future regressions?

mpkorstanje
2017-09-05 23:45:51

Summary Test failure produces this stack trace. Not sure about the circumstances: java.lang.NullPointerException at cucumber.runtime.java8.Java8StepDefinition.isDefinedAt(Java8StepDefinition.java:...
mpkorstanje
2017-09-14 12:52:06

@brasmusson are you building a new release right now?

mpkorstanje
2017-09-14 17:03:14

Trying to make some progress on cucumber-expressions. Noticed a weird inconsistency with the current implementation of regexes and the one in cucumber-expressions. The step definition "the order is placed( and (not yet )?confirmed)?" has 2 arguments and not yet confirmed and not yet while according to cucumber-expressions it only has one. Being and not yet confirmed.

The difference seems to come from how the JdkPatternArgumentMatcher and RegularExpression are implemented. The former grabs all capture groups from left to right, the latter only the top level groups from left to right. @Aslak Helles√∏y is this an intentional change in behaviour?

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/master/core/src/main/java/cucumber/runtime/JdkPatternArgumentMatcher.java https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-expressions-java/blob/master/src/main/java/io/cucumber/cucumberexpressions/RegularExpression.java

GitHub
cucumber/cucumber-jvm
cucumber-jvm - Cucumber for the JVM
GitHub
cucumber/cucumber-expressions-java
cucumber-expressions-java - [READ ONLY] Cucumber Expressions for Java - subtree of monorepo <https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber>
brasmusson
2017-09-15 12:09:27

*Thread Reply:* That could be a regression see https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1191

GitHub
3.0.0.pre.2 - regexp no longer matching correct amount of capture groups ¬∑ Issue #1191 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-ruby
This step definition: Given(/^I have a( trial)? subscription( with (\d+) days left)?$/) do |trial, with_days_left, days_left| end worked in Cucumber pre 3.0. In the latest 3.0 release, it returns: ...
Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-09-16 05:52:05

*Thread Reply:* Cucumber Expressions treats nested capture groups as a tree: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/cucumber-expressions/java/src/main/java/io/cucumber/cucumberexpressions/TreeRegexp.java

GitHub
cucumber/cucumber
cucumber - Cucumber monorepo - polyglot home for Cucumber building blocks
Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-09-16 05:56:20

*Thread Reply:* It's intended behaviour @mpkorstanje and possibly a backwards incompatible change. I think it makes more sense, especially wrt parameter types.

brasmusson
2017-09-14 23:13:39

@mpkorstanje No, I plan to make a new release this weekend.

Gustavo Ballest√© Prado

eyal
2017-10-05 06:37:51

@eyal has joined the channel

eyal
2017-10-05 06:37:55

Hi guys,

eyal
2017-10-05 06:38:19

As I told in #welcome I'm part of Genymotion (an Android emulator)

mlvandijk
2017-10-05 06:39:33

Welcome eyal!

eyal
2017-10-05 06:43:03

Here is my point: We want to provide our users a way to have a deeper interaction with your tool. We would like to be able to inject some logic during the test runs. For example, we want to start an action on the Android device before each test and stop it when the test is finished. We can do this with "standard" espresso test for example by injecting a RunListener into the test runner through a library.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:44:07

Have you tried @Before and @After hooks?

eyal
2017-10-05 06:45:23

Is there a way for us (third party library) to inject our @Before and @After on all each ActivitySteps of our users?

eyal
2017-10-05 06:47:52

On the AndroidJUnitRunner there is a notion of "RunListener" which is able to be aware about the process of the test run. But apparently you are not using it as runner, only for the event injection on the app

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:49:49

Hooks are for users of Cucumber. In your case it's probably better to write your own formatter and ship it as a jar. https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/master/core/src/main/java/cucumber/api/formatter/Formatter.java

GitHub
cucumber/cucumber-jvm
cucumber-jvm - Cucumber for the JVM
eyal
2017-10-05 06:50:51

interesting...

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:50:52

Cucumber ships with some built-in ones you can look at. If you write your own, users can enable it by putting your jar on the classpath and running Cucumber with --format com.genymotion.GenymotionFormatter

eyal
2017-10-05 06:51:22

that's cool

eyal
2017-10-05 06:51:26

I'll dig into this

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:51:44

Let us know how you get on - happy to answer any questions

eyal
2017-10-05 06:52:13

this would be also compatible whatever language the user uses right?

eyal
2017-10-05 06:52:20

(I suppose)

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:52:29

Yes, any language supported by Cucumber-JVM.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:52:46

Java, Clojure, Scala, Groovy, JavaScript, Jython etc

eyal
2017-10-05 06:52:53

it seems very nice, thanks for the pointer

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:53:04

I recommend writing the formatter in Java though üôÇ

eyal
2017-10-05 06:53:15

yeah that's my plan

eyal
2017-10-05 06:53:21

I'll let you know about that

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:53:27

Can I ask you a question @eyal?

eyal
2017-10-05 06:53:28

thanks a lot

eyal
2017-10-05 06:53:31

sure

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:53:48

Do you know the story with Android and Java8?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:54:25

We'd love to move all the source code of Cucumber-JVM to Java8, but we're not sure Android supports that yet?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:54:59

It's hard to figure out for someone who doesn't do regular Android dev üôÇ

eyal
2017-10-05 06:55:08

it is, partly actually

eyal
2017-10-05 06:55:44

if you want to be compatible with all the android setups, you should remain compatible with Java7

eyal
2017-10-05 06:56:19

but let's say recent setup support Java8 compiled binaries

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:56:22

Yes that's what I thought. Do you have a feel for how long it will be like that?

eyal
2017-10-05 06:56:32

I really don't know

eyal
2017-10-05 06:56:58

But you can already develop with Java8 features and compile with the Java7 compatibility

eyal
2017-10-05 06:57:03

and it works

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-05 06:57:20

Ok good to know. Thanks!

2017-10-05 06:58:07

eyal
2017-10-06 06:08:43

@Aslak Helles√∏y I have a proof of concept working. That's really easy. I just have a question, does the testers on Android sometime uses another runner than the Android Runner (embedded into the test application)?

eyal
2017-10-06 06:08:54

For example the command line runner

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-06 06:09:33

No idea @eyal

eyal
2017-10-06 06:13:59

Ok thanks

eyal
2017-10-06 06:17:07

Actually I have the impression that if you use Espresso (the Android standard lib for instrumented tests), there is no way to run it from another way than the Android Runner.

eyal
2017-10-06 06:17:53

But if you use Appium, you uses the command line or JUnit runner

eyal
2017-10-06 06:18:56

Am I wrong ?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-06 06:57:11

I don't do mobile development @eyal

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-06 06:57:26

I've never used any of those tools

eyal
2017-10-06 07:00:17

Ok maybe a "mobile" dev here could answer üôÇ

brasmusson
2017-10-06 12:52:58

@eyal https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1092 indicate that someone is trying to test on Android using the command line runner. How that would be possible I do not understand.

GitHub
cucumber.api.cli.Main cannot recognize step definition files ¬∑ Issue #1092 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-jvm
Summary Using Cucumber.api.cli.Main to test cucumber features in an android project, did not recognize step definition files. Expected Behavior Running cucumber.api.cli.Main should run correctly ...
eyal
2017-10-09 06:07:22

@brasmusson to be honest I'm pretty new to cucumber, I'm not really aware about all the internals. But for me, he tells that "Move the Step Definition files into the main app folder, and run the test again" does the job. The only change here is that you will add your "espresso code" into your application. Which is not good at all IMHO.

eyal
2017-10-09 06:10:18

Usually, instrumented tests on Android applications are working like this. The build system will :

  • build your app on debug mode (the one you want to test)
  • build system builds a testing app (containing the espresso code) that will instrument your app under test and act as a "real" user
  • then it will install the both apps on the device
  • then it starts the test app (from adb command line) and this one will start the instrumentations on the other app
eyal
2017-10-09 06:11:44

But I don't understand for now how the command line runner can transform this into Android tests...

eyal
2017-10-09 06:12:10

My skill are still pretty limited on this üôÇ

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-12 06:44:38

@mpkorstanje and I just moved cucumber-clojure to a separate repo

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-12 06:45:19

We're using https://github.com/ingydotnet/git-subrepo for that. Here is the general recipe:

git subrepo init clojure -r <https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm-clojure.git>
git subrepo push clojure 
git rm -rf clojure/
git commit -m "Move cucumber-clojure to <https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm-clojure>"
GitHub
ingydotnet/git-subrepo
Contribute to git-subrepo development by creating an account on GitHub.
Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-12 06:46:22

We'll be moving all cucumber-language modules to separate repos (except cucumber-java and cucumber-java8)

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-12 06:47:28

They will not be maintained by the current core team, but anyone is welcome to step up and take ownership of any of them.

mpkorstanje
2017-10-12 06:52:36

Hangouts just drained my battery...

mpkorstanje
2017-10-12 06:52:39

Brb

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-12 06:55:43

According to download stats, about 90% of cucumber-jvm users use cucumber-java, and all the other languages (scala, groovy, clojure, jython, jruby, gosu, rhino) account for 10% together.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-12 06:56:56

However, the maintenance cost for each language module is about the same, so by moving them out of the main repo the core team should become significantly more productive.

mlvandijk
2017-10-12 07:30:00

Awesome! üëç:skintone3:

mpkorstanje
2017-10-12 14:24:47

Now that all languages have been moved in to their own repo I have a working version** of cucumber expressions in https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/1248

I am now looking to remove xStream. How do we transform data tables and doc strings? We know the origin type and we know the target type. We can't however use this information to look up a transform in the parameter type registry as there might be multiple transforms for that type with different names (e.g. different date formats).

Currently we support: DocString --> SomeObject DataTable --> List<SomeObject> DataTable --> Map<SomeKeyObject, SomeValueObject> DataTable --> List<Map<SomeKeyObject, SomeValueObject>>

All the conversions to parameterized types won't work with lambda step defs because lambdas lose the parameterized types.

For annotation based step defs the conversion can be registered in these ways:

  1. @Transform annotation on the parameter
  2. @XStreamConverter annotation on SomeObject
  3. A converter for SomeObject registered with the xStreamConverter registry.

I think we can maintain option #1. Replace #2 with @Transform and create a wrapper around the parameterTypeRegistry that lets us do #3.

Long story short. We need a second registry.

Thoughts?

** Some assembly required. Build https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/287 locally first.

GitHub
[WIP] Cucumber expressions by mpkorstanje ¬∑ Pull Request #1248 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-jvm
Summary Cucumber expressions. Still quite broken. Todo: Fix TestNG example Fix Pax Exam example -- depends on cucumber/cucumber#287 Fix Wicket example Fix Webbit example Move Clojure and ...
GitHub
cucumber-expressions: (Java) Make the jar a bundle to support osgi. by mpkorstanje ¬∑ Pull Request #287 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber
Summary Build the cucumber-expressions jar as a OSGi bundle. See also #99. Details Declare the packaging type as bundle Use the maven-bundle-plugin to create the manifest according to the OSGi req...

mlvandijk
2017-10-13 06:04:42

@jreijn what was your question?

jreijn
2017-10-13 06:12:30

ah great thanks! Yeah I was looking at updating an existing formatter and I was using inspiration from the HTMLFormatter. The existing HTMLFormatter (although not part of the public API) uses in inner class called AstNode, which is not available to formatters outside of the cucumber packages. I was wondering if it would be possible to open this up for extension or if there is another way to achieve something similar?

mpkorstanje
2017-10-13 06:15:50

Hello @jreijn I think we've met before. üòÑ

jreijn
2017-10-13 06:16:05

yes we did!

jreijn
2017-10-13 06:16:24

üòÑ

mlvandijk
2017-10-13 06:17:19

Well, @mpkorstanje can probably also help you with that üôÇ

mpkorstanje
2017-10-13 06:28:36

To answer your question. No. Just copy&paste TestSourcesModel. That way your code will be less prone to breaking when cucumber upgrades and the maintainers will have to spend less effort trying to avoid breaking other peoples things. Comes to mind that TestSourcesModel shouldn't be public at all.

You might be better of using the json output and transforming that into your desired out put though.

jreijn
2017-10-13 06:30:23

OK thanks. I figured something like that. I‚Äôll get back when I have further questions

jreijn
2017-10-13 07:02:10

Just one more question: I was looking at all existing Java based Formatters, but none of them are extensible. Was this a deliberate change, because in 1.2 most formatters where extendible.

jreijn
2017-10-13 07:06:40

Sometimes it might be nice to just base a formatter upon another formatter. I‚Äôll manage for now with the API, but just wondering

mpkorstanje
2017-10-13 07:09:31

Yes. With 2.0 we upgraded the gherkin library. The gherkin library no longer provides the formatters so they were moved into cucumber-core. With that upgrade also came the event protocol which doesn't make for easy extensions.

mpkorstanje
2017-10-13 07:09:50

Not that the previous versions were designed for extension. üôÇ

mpkorstanje
2017-10-13 07:10:28

Anyway. What do you need the custom formatter for?

rjwittams
2017-10-22 11:30:01

brasmusson
2017-10-22 11:54:21

IIRC the acceptance test file were at some point only as gherkin/testdata and not also copied to each language version. One reason to copy them to each language version was that the standard installation process for Perl is to run tests at installation time (which requires the testdata to be available among the files of the perl version). Having the testdata copied to each language version does also enable a division of the testing done in the ci pipeline for the mono repo (currently run in Docker), and the ci for each language repo where testing can be done for several compiler/interpretor versions.

mpkorstanje
2017-10-24 10:06:49

@brasmusson @Aslak Helles√∏y it seems that https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/1236 is causing somewhat of an annoyance for people. I think its time to put that out there. Would you object to the release of a 2.1.0 version of cucumber in its current state?

GitHub
Correct the name of the Json Formatter embeddings node by haroon-sheikh ¬∑ Pull Request #1236 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-jvm
Summary JSON formatter outputs the embeddings node as "embedding". Version 1.2.5 and earlier had this node as "embeddings" Details embedding node changed to embeddings in JSONFormatter.java Fixes #...
brasmusson
2017-10-24 12:05:48

What is motivating a 2.1.0 instead of a 2.0.2?

brasmusson
2017-10-24 12:46:23

In the discussion about compiling empty scenarios to empty pickle, it is suggested that the result of executing a test case from an empty pickle should be undefined, and also that a test case from an empty pickles should have no steps (that is no hooks should be added if there are no pickle steps). Cucumber-JVM does not do this today. I have been intending to work on this now when we use Gherkin 5.0. Maybe we should try and fix this before a release. See https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/249 and https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/pull/144#issuecomment-323510760.

GitHub
gherkin: Compiling empty scenarios ¬∑ Issue #249 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber
Summary Currently, the Gherkin pickles compiler removes Gherkin scenarios that don't have any steps, so they don't appear as test cases. I understand why this was done - what's the point in running...
GitHub
Do not create test cases for scenarios with no steps. by brasmusson ¬∑ Pull Request #144 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core
Summary Do not create test cases for scenarios with no steps. Details To be consistent with the (Pickle) compiler in the Gherkin library, test cases should not be created for scenarios with no step...
Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-24 15:26:32

I think it would be great to make a new release with the embedding/embeddings fix.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-24 15:27:25

I don't think it has to wait for the Gherkin 5 upgrade, but it would be nice to have it in if it doesn't take too long.

mpkorstanje
2017-10-24 16:00:07

I'll try and cook up a release this weekend then. Numbers are cheap.

Aslak Helles√∏y

GitHub
cucumber/cucumber-jvm
cucumber-jvm - Cucumber for the JVM
Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-26 12:37:07

Do you have any concerns about it @mpkorstanje?

mpkorstanje
2017-10-26 15:17:23

The bot is not smart enough. I'd rather not babysit its decisions.

  1. It marked issues we have pull requests for like #1066 and #1149.
  2. It doesn't understand context. #974 and #741 only make sense to implement after cucumber-expressions are implemented.
  3. In time it will also close issues that are scheduled for 3.0.0 because of breaking changes which won't be looked at for a while like #1240

And those are things I've been working on! Feels like your baby brother is taking your homework and running to the fireplace. üòÑ

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-27 00:57:35

It's not perfect, but I still think it will make an overall improvement to the project's focus and throughput. Regarding your concerns:

  1. This should get better with https://github.com/probot/stale/pull/69
  2. and 3. can be overridden by tagging issues with Slow Burner
GitHub
Allow different settings for pulls and issues. Add config 'limitPerRun'. by mezz ¬∑ Pull Request #69 ¬∑ probot/stale
Hello, and thanks for the useful bot! You recommended I make a PR, and I hope this makes the bot even better. This PR does two things: Closes #66: Feature Request: different stale settings for PRs...
mlvandijk
2017-10-27 01:01:45

@Aslak Helles√∏y @mpkorstanje Is it possible for stale bot to ignore issues assigned to upcoming milestones? (that might be helpful)

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-27 01:02:45

The only way to tell the bot to ignore issues is to tag them with one of the tags listed in .github/stale.yml

mlvandijk
2017-10-27 01:03:49

or the other way around and add milestone labels to stale.yml?

mlvandijk
2017-10-27 01:04:08

i.e. 'Candidate for 2.x', 'Candidate for 3'

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-10-27 01:05:08

I'd rather not complicate the process around milestones. Would be better to improve the bot, or just use the Slow Burner tag

mlvandijk
2017-10-27 01:05:22

OK, fair enough. Thanks

mpkorstanje
2017-10-28 13:25:42

mpkorstanje
2017-11-08 05:26:05

Mmmh. Java 9 is going to cause some problems.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-11-08 05:26:23

Yeah? How so?

mpkorstanje
2017-11-08 05:32:49

We have some classes from different jars in the same package. As I understand it this is prohibited with the module system

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-11-08 05:33:16

Ah, that should be easy to fix. Bad practice anyway!

mpkorstanje
2017-11-08 05:33:45

To wit the DI factories and some stuff in the spring module.

mpkorstanje
2017-11-08 05:35:38

Migation sounds doable. Not sure if module-info.java is backwards compatible

mpkorstanje
2017-11-08 05:46:32

Okay. As long as we don't have modules the jvm will assume we are in a special module that acts like we are on the class path.

mpkorstanje
2017-11-08 05:47:15

So this wont be much of an issue untill cucumber-jvm upgrades to 9

mpkorstanje
2017-11-08 05:47:57

Presumably. There are some astrixes attached.

2017-11-20 12:53:36

2017-11-20 12:53:48

thomas

2017-11-20 23:50:56

brasmusson
2017-11-21 00:42:37

Pax-exam requires that there is a version of it installed in the maven repo. Travis use 'mvn install -Dskiptests=true' first therefore it workshop there.

thomas
2017-11-21 01:34:58

Ok, so to get pax-exam to work, I need something specific installed in my local Maven repo?

Sound like something that could be nice to address either with documentation or maybe be able to skip the test in that module.

thomas
2017-11-21 01:35:36

Sort of unfortunate, but I'm glad that it isn't my local env that is broken

thomas
2017-11-21 01:49:53

I cloned on my Ubuntu and did nothing more than mvn clean install. It took 11 minutes, downloaded half of the Internet, and then the build passed. I did not install anything special in my local Maven. I don't even know what I need to install. It just worked as I had expected it to do.

thomas
2017-11-21 02:26:58

@brasmusson do I understand you correct if I think that there is a two stage operation to get it to work? First mvn install -Dskiptests=true to install pax-exam Second mvn install to build Cucumber and test everything?

thomas
2017-11-21 02:27:49

And as I wrote, it worked out of the box on an Ubuntu. But not my Mac.

brasmusson
2017-11-21 03:49:35

The error message when running the examples/pax-exam/calculator-test when doing maven install directly indicate that the problem is that the osgi environment cannot determine the highest version number of examples/pax-exam/calculator-api and/or examples/pas-exam/calculator-service (the only two dependencies of examples/pax-exam/calculator-test that do not exist in Maven Central). The remedy for this that I have found is to make sure that examples/pax-exam/calculator-api and examples/pas-exam/calculator-service are installed in the local Maven repo before trying to run examples/pax-exam/calculator-test (I use Ubuntu). Travis indeed does this by executing mvn install -DskipTests=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -B -V before executing the command (mvn -q install) specified in the .travis.yml.

mpkorstanje
2017-11-24 16:38:57

Mmmh. Testing anything with Env is a pain. The class is created once and persists across junit/testng tests. So any changes made to the environment as part of a test (e.g. setting cucumber.options) will affect all tests.

mpkorstanje
2017-11-24 16:43:13

Refactoring it also doesn't appear to be easy as its used through some reflection boundaries (GuiceFactory, Javabackend). I guess we'd have to do some DI here.

mpkorstanje
2017-12-03 13:25:01

@brasmusson @Aslak Helles√∏y I think we have gathered enough bugs and features to make a 2.2.0 release.

mpkorstanje
2017-12-03 13:25:40

I'll try to make one sometime this week

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-03 13:44:57

Sounds great @mpkorstanje - why a minor version bump?

mpkorstanje
2017-12-03 16:31:56

Tag expressions had a minor version bump. So it provides some new features. As a result cucumber-jvm also provides new features.

üëç Aslak Helles√∏y, mlvandijk
mpkorstanje
2017-12-07 15:22:53

This was annoying manual labour though. I think the next release should be done by travis.

The nexus-staging-maven-plugin is smart enough to send snapshots and releases to different repositories. So all we should have to do is run a script that tags and possibly signs the current commit. Then travis can build and release the tagged commit.

mpkorstanje
2017-12-07 15:23:14

**And updates the project version ofcourse.

mpkorstanje
2017-12-07 15:49:16

And I am not the first that wants to do this: http://www.debonair.io/post/maven-cd/

Debonair.io
Complete guide to continuous deployment to maven central from Travis CI ¬∑ Debonair.io
Classy code, debonair developers, inspiring infrastructure, and stylish stacks.
mpkorstanje
2017-12-07 16:17:06

@Aslak Helles√∏y do you trust everyone with push access to master to make releases? That'd be the easiest.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-08 00:40:04

I do @mpkorstanje. In the unlikely event that someone makes a sloppy release we can consider tightening it. I doubt we'll have to. Great power great responsibility etc.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-08 00:41:13

Automating it would be fabulous @mpkorstanje - it's painful right now. Automated release whenever a tag is pushed - is that the idea?

mpkorstanje
2017-12-08 08:33:37

*Thread Reply:* That was the working concept but looks like any build that has a non-snapshot version in the pom can be released automatically.

mpkorstanje
2017-12-08 11:40:26

*Thread Reply:* Effectively the number of commands need to make a release has only been reduced by one.

But because travis can do the deployment now the bus factor has been reduced along with a complicated bit of setup.

Any one with commit rights can prepare the release.

2017-12-10 12:23:36

SUREFIRE-1372 Filter tests to be rerun by description by mpkorstanje ¬∑ Pull Request #150 ¬∑ apache/maven-surefire
Filtering tests by the tuple of (Class, Method) does not work when a test suite is used as a suite may not have (Class, Method) . Filtering by the description of the failed test should however work...

mpkorstanje
2017-12-15 17:54:38

@Aslak Helles√∏y I saw you wanted to get rid of xstream. I don't disagree.

I integrated the datatable/cucumber spike today and noticed that we currently lack any and all functionality required to make TableConverter.toDataTable work.

The TypeRegistry contains sufficient information to transform tables into list of objects but not the other way around. String to Object is fine. Object to String is not.

I've tried to see if this could be replicated with another object mapper (Jackson) but here I run into the problem that the LocalizedXStreams contains converters that work both ways while the TypeRegistry does not. This makes tables without headers problematic. The other tables are fine.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-18 05:29:09

Am I right that object to table is used for table.diff(listOfObject) @mpkorstanje? Anywhere else?

mpkorstanje
2017-12-18 10:19:35

*Thread Reply:* Not in our code. I imagine it is used externally though. You're thinking of dropping it?

mpkorstanje
2017-12-18 10:21:42

*Thread Reply:* If so we can probebly add a List<Map<String, String>> constructor/static factory method that creates a DataTable from a json-ish representation.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-18 10:22:03

*Thread Reply:* I think we should still allow table.diff(listOfObject), which I imagine would require a conversion from Object to List&lt;String&gt; (each object representing a row). We could probably implement a simple implementation for that using reflection, and define an API that would allow people to control conversion themselves.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-18 10:23:14

*Thread Reply:* DataTable should have a List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; constructor, so we only need to convert Object to List&lt;String&gt;

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-18 10:23:48

*Thread Reply:* No need to leak the DataTable API into the conversion API

mpkorstanje
2017-12-18 10:25:14

*Thread Reply:* What do you think of making the reflection/object mappers pluggable? Most tools come with their own set of annotations and conventions e.g. xStream, Jackson and Saxon. Making cucumber agnostic to those would allow people to reuse their domain objects.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-18 10:25:51

*Thread Reply:* I think that would be a great design goal.

mpkorstanje
2017-12-18 10:25:54

*Thread Reply:* It'd also cut down on the initial work for the cucumber expression release if we'd leave them out all together.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2017-12-18 10:26:04

*Thread Reply:* I like the sound of that

mpkorstanje
2017-12-18 10:29:10

*Thread Reply:* Excellent.

haroon
2017-12-28 10:39:37

@haroon has joined the channel

ragab
2017-12-30 00:01:17

@ragab has joined the channel

mpkorstanje
2018-01-05 20:12:23

I've wrapped up most of the DataTable stuff I was working on for Cucumber Expressions. Finishing cxp is just a matter of chasing down lose ends, improving test coverage and writing documentation.

Instead of trying to re-engineer how the transform originally worked with xstream I've tried to define how the transform should work from first principles. I believe the current implementation allows every sensible mapping from a data table to list, map, list of maps and lists of lists. TableConverter.toMap` now works with any size tables (not just the two wide version). The header being is part of the table or part of the data is now also explicit in the Transform. No more guessing what XStream is going to do.

@Aslak Helles√∏y @mlvandijk https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/97460e16e8837238db14ecd86bd4327f074a400d/core/src/main/java/cucumber/api/datatable/TableConverter.java does this make sense?

@brasmusson https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/97460e16e8837238db14ecd86bd4327f074a400d/core/src/main/java/cucumber/api/datatable/DataTableType.java#L137 I don't know how to get rid of this. I need the ability to create types before they exist and I need to be able to create parameterized types from the parameter type. And I don't want to expose the end user to the TypeReference class. So the only thing that comes to mind right now that is remotely doable is re-using jacksons TypeFactory.

GitHub
cucumber/cucumber-jvm
cucumber-jvm - Cucumber for the JVM
mlvandijk
2018-01-05 22:34:08

@mpkorstanje looks clear to me. Would like to actually use it to be sure üôÇ Especially to see how it would actually map to the Artist.class that is not defined in the example (although I can pretty much guess what it would look like). And I'm curious to see how it would work with/without header row, or the first header column left blank.

mlvandijk
2018-01-05 22:34:21

mpkorstanje
2018-01-06 08:15:42

Thanks. The Id thing was intentional. With just numbers it would be feasible to map to int or long instead but I am trying to show it also should work for other types like UUIDs.

mlvandijk
2018-01-14 03:44:05

https://maarten.mulders.tk/blog/2018/01/migrating-to-java9.html

maarten.mulders.tk
I upgraded to Java 9 - here's what happened
I recently participated in a Twitter conversation about upgrading to Java 9. Like most of the people, my current projects are all on Java 8. Of course the question came up, why don‚Äôt you upgrade? G...
mlvandijk
2018-01-14 03:59:47

Didnt read fully yet but might be interesting?

mpkorstanje
2018-01-14 05:03:34

Cheers but unfortunately his problems are all well known and documented by Oracles migration guide.

https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/migrate/toc.htm

As Maartens dependencies are civilized members of the java community and supported by major industry players he didn't have any real issues.

What we are running into now is that our dependencies are not so well behaved. Cucumber grew up in a rough neighborhood and Java 9 does not appreciate how its friends keep picking random locks and checking windows.

To be specific we have several dependencies that use ASM for byte code instruction that haven't updated to the latest version yet. We also have several dependencies that try to access private parts of the java libraries in ways that are now forbidden.

Upgrading these will be a bit more involved. üòî

mlvandijk
2018-01-14 05:26:07

Sorry...

mpkorstanje
2018-01-14 05:35:35

It will be alright. üòÑ

2018-02-06 10:32:52

mpkorstanje

@Aslak Helles√∏y @brasmusson

I'm thinking of 2.4.0 release with the changes currently in git.

Then start a 3.0.0 release with the items from that milestone. This will include the before and after step hooks which is a feature people have been asking for allot so it is a good one to start a major on.

However I've also been working on cucumber-expressions. These are also a breaking changes but I am afraid that the review process will take some time so I'd rather not see that it blocks the before and after step hooks.

Personally I would prefer not to stack too many breaking changes. What do you think?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:26:36

Oh yes that

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:28:29

One thing I've been thinking about is to make Cucumber-JVM work a bit more like SpecFlow. SpecFlow generates NUnit classes from Feature files. If we did the same, we wouldn't have to maintain a separate JUnit plugin, and supporting JUnit 5 would just be a matter of changing the code generator. WDYT?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:29:12

We could make a code generation library that only depends on Gherkin, and IDEs could use them to make it happen transparently.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:29:46

@Andrey Vokin - interested in hearing your thoughts on this too.

Andrey Vokin
2018-03-09 06:29:50

@Andrey Vokin has joined the channel

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:31:34

Example here: https://github.com/cucumber-ltd/shouty.net/blob/master/Shouty.Specs/HearShout.feature.cs

GitHub
cucumber-ltd/shouty.net
<a href="http://shouty.net">shouty.net</a> - Shouty exercise in .NET
mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 06:32:38

Do you have an example that includes DI?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:34:39

Not at hand, but that wouldn't be affected. Users would still write StepDef classes as before. The generated JUnit classes would just use an API to start a new scenario (in a JUnit @Before), and that's where the DI would happen

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:36:43

We already have that API internally, just need to open it up a bit so the generated classes can use it.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:37:32

I think step 1 is to write such a JUnit class by hand, and refactor the API to make it work.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 06:38:20

I'm thinking it through

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:38:46

This is the interesting bit: https://github.com/cucumber-ltd/shouty.net/blob/b7d90876cf64344dbf194af511526dcbedcc1d87/Shouty.Specs/HearShout.feature.cs#L66-L83

GitHub
cucumber-ltd/shouty.net
<a href="http://shouty.net">shouty.net</a> - Shouty exercise in .NET
mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 06:49:16

In isolation I think it is a pretty effective idea.

Zooming out a bit we'd have to trigger the code generation somehow. This needs to be done by IDE's or build systems like maven or gradle. So we'd have to provide and maintain plugins for those in addition to the code generation for junit4, junit5, testng, ect.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:51:58

That's true. I'm thinking a codegen lib which ships with a CLI. Building adapters for IDEs and build systems should be relatively easy.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:53:09

That's a bit more code to maintain, but on the flip side, lots of code can be removed too. IDE plugins become simpler - they don't need to know how to run Cucumber - they just run JUnit. We can also remove our own JUnit plugin.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:53:32

In the interim we could obviously support both

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:53:49

But in the long term I think maintenance will be simpler and UX better

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 06:54:27

Mmh. I do know that exclipse has a hard time dealing with code generators. It can't execute them as part of the maven build cycle. IDEA has the same problem.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 06:54:46

**Eclipse has its own build cycle that runs next to mavens.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:55:21

IDEA's updated Cucumber plugin would just run the code generator whenever a feature file is saved.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:55:33

Same for Eclipse

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 06:56:51

They'd have to be informed by the pom/build.gradle though. Can plugins do that?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 06:57:34

The IDEA plugin would have to be informed by the pom? What do you mean?

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 06:59:02

The pom will contain settings used to generate code when used by maven. IDEA will have to use the same settings or the build won't be representative.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:00:23

If the IDE regenerates the source code on every save, the build tool doesn't need to worry about that.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:00:54

The generated code would be added to git

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:01:17

Adding generated code to source control is a bad practice.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:01:24

Why?

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:04:56

It allows feature files to diverge from the generated code when edited outside of a properly configured IDE.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:05:54

Sure, that's certainly a possibility. And I agree it would be nice to not have to do it.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:06:00

Generating the generated code with each build ensures that people can't forget to generate new code and that any changes to the generation instructions are immediately included.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:06:42

I think a good solution is to have the trigger generation, but also to have the build tool do it.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:06:59

Yup.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:07:10

The generator wouldn't regenerate if it's already uptodate

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:08:27

So that means we'd probably have to write a Maven plugin that could hook into surefire's cycle somehow right?

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:08:38

Yup.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:08:46

Err, the compiler plugin's cycle

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:10:52

I think adopting JUnit5 will give us much of the same advantages.

Have you had a look at JUnit5 Runners yet? We can in theory make it so that you can point it at a feature file, a folder, or even a whole project and say execute this.

Then all IDE's only have to interface with JUnit5. Maven already supports JUnit5.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:12:04

It doesn't need the weird @RunWith annotation. But we do have to make some assumptions about the scope of the glue. It has to be everything in the project.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:13:10

And I haven't found a way to provide @CucucumberOptions yet.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-09 07:14:51

I'd love to get rid of @CucumberOptions and use a config file instead. That would allow the same config to be picked up regardless of how you launch Cucumber

‚úÖ mlvandijk
mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:15:18

2018-03-09 07:17:36

cucumber-pro-plugin-jvm - Cucumber plugin for Cucumber Pro

2018-03-09 07:18:29

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 07:18:42

2018-03-09 07:20:23

mlvandijk
2018-03-09 11:05:36

mpkorstanje
2018-03-09 20:02:53

Hacked some bits together.

Test discovery with Jupiter works out of the box with IDEA. This shows Junit5 and Cucumber tests together. The former being discovered by JupiterEngine, the later by CucumberEngine.

Both got kicked off telling by idea to run all test in the project root. It works the same for files.

brasmusson
2018-03-09 23:34:38

What about TestNG, should we be able to generate TestNG test classes too (and remove the TestNG module)?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-03-10 09:25:08

*Thread Reply:* If we go for a code generation approach we‚Äôd have an option to generate TestNG. Specflow lets you choose between mstest, nunit and xunit as generation targets.

brasmusson
2018-03-09 23:39:20

> Then start a 3.0.0 release with the items from that milestone. This will include the before and after step hooks

Do you see the after step hooks as a breaking change that forces a new major version? I've thought of it as a addition.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-10 03:17:15

It is a new feature and byte code wise it is okay. But it changes the events and their ordering and adds an enum value to the hook type. This means certain assumptions about the event stream that were valid in the past no longer hold.

Previously we had [[hook]**, [step]+, [hook]**]. Now we have [[hook]**, [[hook]**, step, [hook]**]+, [hook]**].

Consumers may not expect any steps after the first hook following a step. And they may assume that any hook is either a before or after.

The latter assumption broke the HTML formatter for instance.

mpkorstanje
2018-03-10 07:16:59

Arguably it is not a major break. But majors should go up for breaking changes. And since we're breaking it might as well break it properly.

And I guess we should document what a consumer may expect.

2018-03-13 20:24:45

[Solved[ ~Is there a reason why in the Maven submodules we don't use relativePath?~ e.g. &lt;parent&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;io.cucumber&lt;/groupId&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;cucumber-jvm&lt;/artifactId&gt; &lt;version&gt;3.0.0-SNAPSHOT&lt;/version&gt; &lt;relativePath&gt;..&lt;/relativePath&gt; &lt;/parent&gt; ~My Maven skills lack but without it, when changing the root pom.xml, I have to install it to verify the changes in submodules. Or is there something I'm missing?~

mpkorstanje
2018-04-22 02:50:39

üëç paoloambrosio

paoloambrosio
2018-04-22 03:11:53

*Thread Reply:* Of course you were right üòâ Maven doesn't seem to be able to resolve cross-module dependencies unless they have been installed already or is building from the root project.

paoloambrosio
2018-04-24 00:56:50

I am trying to implement ScalaTest support, that shouldn't depend on class annotations. I found out that to create a RuntimeOptions object I have to pass command line parameters, that would basically mean copy/pasting from RuntimeOptionsFactory, that of course is not good. This is what I found...

  • RuntimeOptions is constructed from command line parameters, instead of being just a value object
  • RuntimeOptionsFactory in reality converts CucumberOptions annotations in a class and its superclasses into command line parameters
    • it needs to know how the CLI works in order to create a RuntimeOptions object

Also JUnit options seem to leak into the Core module, but I'm not convinced they relate only to JUnit (despite being used only there)...

  • CucumberOptions is used by JUnit, TestNG and Android modules, and has a junit parameter
  • JUnitOptions seems to be used only by the JUnitReporter, that is used only by cucumber.api.junit.Cucumber feature runner
    • it contains filenameCompatibleNames and stepNotifications that don't look related to JUnit
    • it is constructed with command line parameters even if it is always used from annotations (annotations -> command line -> JUnitOptions)

The minimum refactoring I can do is to:

  • extract from RuntimeOptionsFactory the part that creates the command line to avoid code duplication

Better refactoring:

  • extract command line parsing out of RuntimeOptions, into a CommandLineRuntimeOptionsFactory
  • rename RuntimeOptionsFactory into AnnotationBasedRuntimeOptionsFactory
  • make JUnitOptions part of RuntimeOptions instead of being a List&lt;String&gt; that is then parsed separately by the constructor of JUnitOptions

WDYT?

üëç mpkorstanje, mlvandijk
mpkorstanje
2018-04-24 03:45:33

*Thread Reply:* I really like the general trust of it.

I had looked at this earlier and this sounds about right. There is however some weird ordering going where we're also parsing the cucumber.options environment parameter.

mpkorstanje
2018-04-24 03:46:06

*Thread Reply:* But if you think you can make that work too. Do it!

mpkorstanje
2018-04-24 03:46:48

*Thread Reply:* I suspect that to make this testable you'll also have to refactor Env.

paoloambrosio
2018-04-24 05:48:34

*Thread Reply:* Thanks for the extra pointers! I'll try and submit a separate PR to refactor RuntimeOptions before I keep working on ScalaTest support... unless I go crazy in the process üòÑ

brasmusson
2018-04-24 08:02:43

*Thread Reply:* The JUnit options controls details of the notifications to the JUnit listeners (IDE:s, maven, gradle etc). Therefore they were deliberately not added to the RuntimeOptions other than as pass through strings - so that such options can be added or deleted without changing the core module.

brasmusson
2018-04-24 08:09:48

*Thread Reply:* > even if it is always used from annotations

No they can also be passed outside the annotations. For instance the CucumberOptions annotations might not set the filenameCompatibleNames so that when executing the test from the IDE (right click -> Run as JUnit test), the tree in the JUnit tab get the actual feature/scenario names. But when using gradle from the command line -Dcucumber.options="--junit,--filenamecompatiblenames" are used so that the names gradle use for the (scenario) result files are constrained to [a-zA-Z0-9_]. The content of the RuntimeOptions can be the result of a set of CucucmberOptions annotations (in a class hierarchy) and the -Dcucumber.options setting at the same time.

paoloambrosio
2018-04-24 09:17:10

*Thread Reply:* Thanks, @brasmusson. Now it makes more sense. I'll have another look and submit a proposal that takes that into consideration (perhaps just a fallback to "minimum refactoring" above). Can you confirm that annotations and system/env properties are the only two ways of passing JUnit parameters? (no CLI)

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-04-24 10:37:35

*Thread Reply:* The RuntimeOptions code is some of the most complex code in Cucumber-JVM and I‚Äôd like to simplify it by basing it on this: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/config/README.md

GitHub
cucumber/cucumber
cucumber - Cucumber monorepo - polyglot home for Cucumber building blocks
Original URL: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/config/README.md
Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-04-24 10:40:18

*Thread Reply:* It‚Äôs about time we have a consistent way to specify configuration across implementations, and a way to do it that isn‚Äôt as complicated as what we currently have in RuntimeOptions.

brasmusson
2018-04-24 12:08:31

*Thread Reply:* When using the JUnit runner, then the options to be considered are the ones from the CucumberOptions annotations in the runner class hierarchy and the system/env, so yes the options to the JUnit module can only be passed from there.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-04-24 12:30:52

*Thread Reply:* The config library supports taking values from an annotation, so that shouldn‚Äôt be a problem.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-04-24 12:34:48

*Thread Reply:* BTW, Env will be obsoleted by the config library. I‚Äôll see if I can integrate it on a branch. I think ScalaTest integration would be a lot easier after that @paoloambrosio

üéä paoloambrosio

2018-05-22 11:16:04

That that tag is on a ancestor of master doesn't mean anything to travis.

@mpkorstanje I investigated the issue about using cucumber with an android project. I experimented with this project : https://github.com/emmasuzuki/CucumberEspressoDemo. cucumber-android rocks with version 1.2.5 until 2.4.0 but since 3.0.0 it sucks.

emmasuzuki/CucumberEspressoDemo

2018-05-23 14:20:06

The full pattern is: Pattern.compile("\{.**?}")

mpkorstanje
2018-05-23 14:28:02

This looks like a bug in Android:

This works: Pattern.compile("\\{.**?\\}");, this doesn't Pattern.compile("\\{.**?}");

mpkorstanje
2018-05-24 03:05:43

Okay. I've spend too much of my spare time on this now. As much as I'd love to dig into this further I do have other things that need to be done.

@Nicolas if you want to pick up where I left off you can build cucumber-expressions/java from https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/fix-android-cucumber-expressions and run the example project in https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/tree/fix-android The errors show up in Logcat. So if more regexes pop up they should be easy to locate and fix.

GitHub
cucumber/cucumber
cucumber - Cucumber monorepo - polyglot home for Cucumber building blocks
Original URL: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/fix-android-cucumber-expressions

Original URL: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/tree/fix-android
brasmusson
2018-05-24 03:22:18

> There is a manifest that contains the permissions to read and write external storage

@mpkorstanje For Android 6 and later there seems to be a need to request permissions at runtime and permission in manifest does not work, see https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1065#issuecomment-255021481

GitHub
Crash on android 6.0+ due to permission issue ¬∑ Issue #1065 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-jvm
It failed to create directory. It should be caused by permission issue. On android 6.0+, user needs to request permissions at run time. Crash log: 09-29 09:05:39.933: E/AndroidRuntime(3039): cucumb...
Original URL: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1065#issuecomment-255021481
mpkorstanje
2018-05-24 10:37:30

Thanks!

mpkorstanje
2018-05-25 18:01:49

All fixed now.@Nicolas can you use https://docs.cucumber.io/installation/java/#snapshot-releases to test the lastest build? Because this is a problem in such a low level dependency I'd prefer to have confirmation from a real world example rather then our limited integration tests.

2018-05-28 13:00:18

2018-05-28 13:45:44

2018-05-28 13:46:03

2018-05-28 13:52:13

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-05-28 13:52:39

2018-05-28 13:53:13

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-05-28 13:53:34

2018-05-28 13:57:10

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-05-28 14:57:33

It is currently the only way to properly test if our OSGI stuff won't break.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:36:41

The OSGI stuff requires we add a manifest in every jar.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:37:16

And missing manifests problems only show up at runtime.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:37:55

That‚Äôs stupid

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:38:47

So if you‚Äôre writing an OSGI app, all your dependencies, including test libraries need this manifest in their jars? That sounds bonkers.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:40:33

Yup. And I really hope I am misunderstading something somewhere.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:40:53

Or perhaps PAX exam is a bad example.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:41:36

I have never worked with OSGI, so I don‚Äôt really know what kind of problems it solves. Hot deployment?

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:43:01

It's a module system. If you have two dependencies, A and B, and A uses C v1 and B uses C v2 but neither exports any elements of C, you can use them together

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:43:49

Great. Still not sure why it virally requires test tools to change though

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:44:41

Good question. I think that for PAX exam we're loading into a running server to do the cucumber tests

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:45:07

Because the server has to load Cucumber, cucumber and its deps have to have a manifest

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:47:15

I see. And running inside a server does some strict checking on dependencies, which causes builds to break nilly willy?

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:47:28

Not willy nilly

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:47:39
 
 mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "pax-exam-calculator-api"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "pax-exam-calculator-service"),

            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "gherkin"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "tag-expressions"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "datatable"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "datatable-dependencies"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "cucumber-expressions"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "cucumber-core"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "cucumber-java"),
            mavenBundle("io.cucumber", "cucumber-osgi"),

            mavenBundle("org.slf4j", "slf4j-api"),
            mavenBundle("ch.qos.logback", "logback-core"),
            mavenBundle("ch.qos.logback", "logback-classic"),
mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:47:51

In Pax Exam we tell it to bundle our dependencies

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:47:57

But we do this withouth a version

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:48:02

So it assumes the latest

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:48:23

But this mechanism is borked when used in combination with maven

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:48:34

Because the latest isn't anywhere to be found.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:48:41

Or not in the manifest.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:48:49

Or some other variation when working with snapshots

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:49:04

We can add version numbers here

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:49:13

But that means we now have two sets of version numbers

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:49:16

Which is also annoying

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:49:20

And equally prone to breaking

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:49:25

What file was that you referred to above?

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:49:38

cucumber.examples.java.paxexam.test.CalculatorTest

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:51:49

Correction: Pax exam isn't starting a server. But it is starting up an OSGI module system.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:52:26

Right, some sort of container with its own class loader

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:52:33

Yeah.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:53:25

Taking a step back. What would an OSGI developer do if they wanted to use library X that lacks an OSGI manifest?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:53:40

Surely that must be a common scenario

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:54:44

Good question

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:55:05

I think we should make it their problem, not ours

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:55:54

I recall some tickets about them asking us to make our jars osgi compliant

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:56:39

Which we did, but now it‚Äôs causing problems.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:57:11

They can do it: https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SSHR6W/com.ibm.websphere.wdt.doc/topics/tcrtbundlefromjar.html#crt.bundle.from.jar

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 06:57:35

I‚Äôm sure there are other ways to do it

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 06:59:50

I am going to check some history to see if I can find out when this madness got started

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 07:00:04

But yeah. I lets move it out.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 07:00:27

Knowing when it got started will make it a bit easier to explain

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-02 07:01:09

Having all this stuff int the core that we don‚Äôt fully understand or care about is an impediment.

mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 07:01:50

Yup.

brasmusson
2018-06-02 11:25:39

> What would an OSGI developer do if they wanted to use library X that lacks an OSGI manifest?

Wrap the jar of library X in a OSGI module (a jar with a OSGI manifest), and declare that the jar should be on the classpath and that its classes should be exported by the OSGI module.

brasmusson
2018-06-02 11:27:13

Several year ago a did a bit Eclipse plugin development (Eclipse is OSGI).

brasmusson
2018-06-02 11:29:58

Testing in OSGI can be done by (in a sense) letting src/main/java define your OSGI module and src/test/java define a OSGI fragment to the OSGI module - then the test code is loaded and executed within the OSGI module you are developing.

brasmusson
2018-06-02 11:34:52

At the time I actually tried to warp Cucumber-JVM v1.1.1 (or something) in an OSGI module to see it would be possible to use it in tests. The thing that finally blocked me was that Cucumber-JVM reported "no backends found on the classpath". I concluded that I did not know enough about the handling of the classpath and exporting/importing in OSGI to continue at this path.

brasmusson
2018-06-02 11:41:57

> A uses C v1 and B uses C v2 but neither exports any elements of C, you can use them together

And you get the ability to specify exactly which classes from a OSGI module other OSGI modules can use (instead of being able to use all public classes in a jar), so your get the ability to specify module level interfaces better.

brasmusson
2018-06-02 11:49:49

> Or some other variation when working with snapshots

One thing I realized is that OSGI/Pax-Exam only are able to use modules installed in repos, not modules build in your project. I CI we install before running test (Travis does mvn install -DskipTests=true first), but locally you often do mvn test/verify/(or something) which makes the newly built modules unavailable to Pax-Exam.

‚úÖ mlvandijk
mpkorstanje
2018-06-02 12:40:06

That would explain some of it. The bug I usually run into is an exception thrown when PAX tries to parse 1-SNAPSHOT as a number. ü§î

brasmusson
2018-06-03 08:14:31

The Cucumber-JVM pom.xml specifies that the dependency version of cucumber-expressions is 5.0.19. Based on that the generated OSGI manifest for the cucumber-core module states in the Import-package sections that the version of cucumber-expressions need to be "[5.0,6)".

Now when v6.0.0 of cucumber-expressions has been released (and since we do not specify versions in cucumber.examples.java.paxexam.test.CalculatorTest I guess), the OSGI runtime resolves the cucumber-expressions version (latest) to v6.0.0 (more specifically to ~/.m2/repository/io/cucumber/cucumber-expressions/6.0.0/cucumber-expressions-6.0.0.jar - which will be downloaded from maven central if not already available locally) and installs in in the OSGI runtime.

Then the OSGI runtime fails to start the (in the runtime installed version of) cucumber-core, since it depends on a cucumber-expressions version "[5.0,6)" and no such version of cucumber-expressions has been installed into the OSGI runtime.

mlvandijk
2018-06-27 00:23:19

@grasshopper The Formatter interface should be deprecated: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1401

GitHub
Deprecate the Formatter interface ¬∑ Issue #1401 ¬∑ cucumber/cucumber-jvm
They formatter interface is a marker interface that used to inform Cucumber that the class implementing it was a plug-in that should be provided with events. This functionality has since fallen apa...
Original URL: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1401
mpkorstanje
2018-06-27 09:27:06

4.0.0 should still have the formatters. Can you share a link?

To make a long story short, getting global hooks right will be hard. Esp when running in parallel with JUnit or TestNG as cucumber won't know when the test is over.

brasmusson
2018-06-27 09:41:58

Also, it is not correct, even when using single treaded execution, to assume that the Pickles will be executed in the order that the Compiler emits them, for instance Cucumber-Ruby has an option for executing the Pickles in random order.

kuba
2018-06-28 02:07:10

Hi! I was looking into updating cucumber-jvm-scala up to date with cucumber-jvm. I‚Äôm at the point it compiles, but there are still few things that need doing.

One of those things is cucumber expressions related changes. Am I right to assume that automatic type conversion won‚Äôt work anymore with regular expressions? I mean if I use \d+ it used to be properly casted to int, double etc, depending on what‚Äôs the type accepted by the method. It‚Äôs always an integer now. I need to use cucumber expressions to get more specific type. Is this correct, or have i missed something?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 02:56:43

Hi @kuba! The cucumber-expressions library has built-in support for Regexp, and as you‚Äôve seen, -d+ is converted to an int by the library. Are you trying to use \d+ with a stepdef that expects a double?

kuba
2018-06-28 03:01:35

> Are you trying to use \d+ with a stepdef that expects a double?

Yes, the existing tests verify that \d+ in regexp can be injected into step def as a double/integer/etc. It used to work, but after updating all the libs it doesn‚Äôt anymore. I wonder if it‚Äôs expected (and cucumber expressions should be used instead of regexp), or I missed something while updating.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:02:30

I can‚Äôt think of a good reason to declare a double parameter for a \d+ capture group, so that sounds like an obsolete test.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:03:20

The big change is that the type isn‚Äôt determined by looking at the function/block/method‚Äôs parameters, but rather by the type declared by the Cucumber Expression ParameterType itself.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:04:18

There are built-in types for numbers, which determine the type.

kuba
2018-06-28 03:04:52

that‚Äôs what i thought. just wanted to make sure. these are the step defs i‚Äôm talking about btw: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm-scala/blob/master/scala/sources/src/test/scala/cucumber/runtime/scala/test/StepDefs.scala#L41-L73

kuba
2018-06-28 03:05:01

so i just planned to convert them to cucumber expressions

kuba
2018-06-28 03:05:18

i.e. Given("""^I have eaten (.**) doubles$""") => Given("""I have eaten {double} doubles""")

kuba
2018-06-28 03:05:45

there‚Äôs few unsupported I think (bool and char)

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:05:48

Yes, that sounds good!

kuba
2018-06-28 03:06:24

and for others i need to figure out how to replace the Transformer

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:06:36

We use some heuristics to determine if an expression is a Regexp or a Cukexp, as there is no literal // syntax for regexp in Java. Does Scala have it?

kuba
2018-06-28 03:07:15

the replacement i gave above just works

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:07:29

In JavaScript, /foo/ is a regexp (obviously) and 'foo' is a cukexp.

kuba
2018-06-28 03:07:38

i think matching is actually done by java8 code

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:07:44

I don‚Äôt think you need treble quotes though?

kuba
2018-06-28 03:07:54

ah, yeah, probably not

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:08:20

kuba
2018-06-28 03:10:14

it‚Äôs just a raw string

kuba
2018-06-28 03:10:21

so any quotes inside don‚Äôt need to be escaped

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-06-28 03:10:27

kuba
2018-06-28 03:11:41

Summary The Java Gherkin parser is gone! The package has moved to io.cucumber.gherkin Details Parsing is delegated to a subprocess (gherkin-go executable) Motivation and Context Less code to mainta...

A few months ago we moved the JVM language modules out of cucumber-jvm into standalone git repositories/maven projects. Last week we removed OSGi - see #1404. I want to move cucumber-android to a s...

grasshopper
2018-07-20 04:48:42

Is parallel execution https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/1389 possible through CucumberOptions on runner? Could only get it to work by passing arguments to Main. Am I missing something?

boaty82 (https://github.com/boaty82)
#1389 [Core] Parallel cukes
<p><strong>Notice</strong></p> <p>This PR replaces <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/1357">Parallel support #1357</a> and relies on <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/1367">Refactor Runtime #1367</a></p> <p><strong>Outline</strong></p> <p>I‚Äôve previously used another implementation to deliver parallel execution of cucumber tests, however it basically wrapped up the creation and execution of <code>Runtime</code>‚Äôs, followed by the need to merge the multiple JSON/HTML etc reports that followed.</p> <p>I reviewed the current implementation and also took note of comments in <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/630">Support concurrent executions of scenarios</a> also I perused all tickets related to running in <https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&amp;q=is%3Aissue+parallel|parallel cukes> for other insights</p> <p><strong>Main changes</strong> <strong>Added <code>--threads</code> argument to runtime options</strong></p> <p>Allows users to specify the (max) number of threads to be used to run the tests</p> <p>The actual number of threads used will be the smaller of the given <code>--threads</code> value and the number of features to be executed</p> <p>Tests are placed into a <code>Queue</code> and consumed by each thread when needed, resulting in a more performant usage of the threads &amp; less deterministic order of Features being run</p> <p><strong>New formatter introduced <code>TimelineFormatter</code></strong></p> <p>Which produces reports using <a href="http://visjs.org/examples/timeline/groups/groups.html">vsjis.org timeline</a> to highlight which feature was run on which Thread and when.<br /> <strong>Note:</strong> the resources (js, html etc) are currently within <code>cucumber-core</code> if the PR is accepted then I‚Äôd imagine these would have to be moved out into its own project, similarly to cucumber-html.<br /> <a href="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8507223/41845545-bfe7ac7e-786b-11e8-929b-4af5ca883e4a.png">timelineformatter</a><br /> <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/files/2132738/example.zip">example.zip</a></p> <p><strong>Types of changes</strong></p> <p>‚òê Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue). ‚òëÔ∏é New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality). ‚òëÔ∏é Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected).<br /> ~- <code>Runtime</code> constructor now private <code>Runtime.Builder</code> introduce to hide away boiler plate setup/instantiation code~</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>‚òëÔ∏é I've added tests for my code. ‚òëÔ∏é My change requires a change to the documentation. ‚òê I have updated the documentation accordingly.</p>
Comments
54
Milestone

mpkorstanje
2018-07-20 07:39:20

pabender
2018-08-24 07:25:54

Hi all.
It has been a while since I have been on here. My day job as a college professor has kept me pretty busy over the last 6 months or so.

My day job is also what brings me back here. I am teaching a class this semester where senior students in our software engineering program are tasked with building one or more increments of a software product.

Since I volunteered last December to be the maintainer for cucumber-jvm-jython, one of the projects I am offering to students is to help bring the features in line with the current capabilities of cucumber-jvm.

I know from previous discussions that things like dependency injection don‚Äôt currently work in this environment. I would like to know what else any of you know is missing. It would benefit my students if we could list these as issues on github.

My students know a bit about test driven development, but only one of them knows anything about cucumber, so I expect it will be a few weeks before they really start looking at the code.

Thanks!

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-08-24 12:50:07

Hi @pabender good to hear from you. Happy to answer questions from you or students here

2018-08-25 02:14:39

mpkorstanje
2018-08-31 16:01:17

@Aslak Helles√∏y For v5 I think we should implement gherkin 6, compile to java 8 and get rid of cucumber.api.

Only for the latter I am not sure yet where to move the contents to cucumber.api.

I've been extracting components that are quite reusable.

Only runtime options, plugins and rerun are still tangled.

Mostly because both plugins and rerun are parsing things for runtime options (they shouldn't, parsing config is the domain of options).

mpkorstanje
2018-08-31 16:02:11

So I am pondering the dispersal of api over multiple packages

brasmusson
2018-09-03 00:38:44

Sounds like a parallel to me bringing back dialect.rb to get Cucumber-Ruby working with Gherkin v6 (https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/commit/1e4c92d6f94cfb043e20e045b270897521e152c0). Note that the go binary can provide the data of the dialects with the --dialects option (when built for dist), so the DialectProvider does not need access to the gherkin-languages.json

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-09-16 02:15:23

Hey @mpkorstanje you can use the cukebot user for releases. All credentials are in 1Password. I‚Äôm in the process of automating releases in the monorepo. Push a tag -> packages get released. Releases are too hard right now!

mpkorstanje
2018-09-16 02:17:23

mpkorstanje

mpkorstanje
2018-09-16 02:17:56

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-09-16 02:41:39

There is a RELEASE_PROCESS.md document that describes it. Many things can go wrong, which is why I want CI to do releases. But you can give it a try!

2018-09-16 02:48:13

2018-09-16 03:16:10

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-09-17 15:53:31

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-09-17 16:08:57

Easy to use from Travis: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/deployment/bintray/

mpkorstanje
2018-09-17 22:37:22

Doesn't look like it supports multi-module.

mpkorstanje
2018-09-17 22:41:00

Manual file name inclusions, yuk.

mpkorstanje
2018-09-17 22:47:00

The advantage of the maven plugin is that you don't have to configure allot of magic. It's all standard and maven knows about it.

Now we'd have to run the whole process, and configure the jar, signature, hash and meta data. For each module.

mpkorstanje
2018-09-17 22:48:53

And they both need some user, private key config and private key password. Not sure this improves anything.

mpkorstanje
2018-09-17 22:54:40

I think the process is pretty easy at the moment. You run the maven commands and you're done.

mpkorstanje
2018-09-17 22:55:44

The sona type step can be removed by telling the plugin to auto drop

2018-09-18 15:07:46

mlvandijk (https://github.com/mlvandijk)
#3 Up cucumber-jvm version to 4.0.0 (Fixes #2)
<p>‚Ä¢ Up the cucumber-jvm version from 2.3.1 to 4.0.0 (current version) ‚Ä¢ Use one version for cucumber-jvm in pom.xml (easier updates/less trouble) ‚Ä¢ Update maven archetype version (not sure if correct; please check)</p>

Andrew Peacock
2018-10-31 18:40:21

@Andrew Peacock has joined the channel

Andrew Peacock
2018-10-31 18:55:27

Hello, friends! I'm currently attending the BDD event in Boston with Matt. I've been using cucumber for some time now (about 1.5 years) and we have nearly 400 feature files executing on a constant basis (through Jenkins!)..

I've had this idea for some time and I'm curious on your thoughts. While this starts with cucumber-jvm (because I'm a java dev) it most certainly could be extended across other domain languages.

Our problem creating feature files is an "inventory" of step definitions. Often times we know we've already implemented a step definition of the sort and we simply need to reuse the gherkin syntax (so we don't have too many sentences just word-smithed around). IntelliJ IDEA has slightly "solved" this by their cucumber plugin having autocompletion of steps. (See the bottom of https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/creating-step-definition.html).

I'd think we could create a tool that easily allows creators of all levels (I'm thinking QA, dev, BA, etc.) to easily inventory what steps are already created within the glue-path. This may be additionally helpful as new people are ramping onto a project and gives you a "warm-fuzzy" about what type of coverage you're accounting for. Furthermore (and perhaps this is an additional feature altogether) it'd be REALLY cool if (by an additional annotation - a "tag" (not to be confused with cucumber tags) or metadata of sorts) that these analytics could help create pivot tables such that anyone (not just devs, etc.) can aggregate and easily see what "types" of step-definitions your product has. For example, say I have a handful of steps who's functionality is to simply ingest data, in my pivot table I could aggregate and slide in the "ingest" metadata which would filter out my list of available step definitions.

I'm excited to hear your thoughts!

Aslak Helles√∏y
2018-11-01 02:07:59

*Thread Reply:* I think this would be amazing @Andrew Peacock - let‚Äôs continue the conversation here: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/521

aslakhellesoy (https://github.com/aslakhellesoy)
#521 Proposal: Step definition inventory in message protocol
<p>Large projects have lots of step definitions. Knowing what step definitions are available can become a bit of. challenge for users. Tools like IDEA help, but it relies on sources to be available. Some teams package up reusable step definitions in modules, and these aren‚Äôt easily available.</p> <p>If the message protocol supported a way to represent all available step definition expressions, this metadata could be embedded in modules (for example in <code>cucumber-metadata.protobuf</code> or <code>cucumber-metadata.json</code>). Other authoring and documentation tools could also take advantage of this metadata to provide a list of step definitions, autocomplete and validation.</p> <p>See <a href="https://cucumberbdd.slack.com/archives/C6RLMP3C4/p1541037327028300">this discussion</a> for more context.</p>
Labels
type: enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>
Christian Hujer
2018-11-27 02:47:56

*Thread Reply:* I second this. Whenever I recommend Cucumber or train Cucumber, I tell people that you need to manage your repository (you call it inventory, same thing) of step definitions properly, to avoid redundancy and increase consistency and reuse. And for now, I'm not aware of any other automated solution than what IntelliJ IDEA does.

Andrew Peacock
2018-11-27 19:20:10

*Thread Reply:* Here‚Äôs a great overflow response comparing these results

Andrew Peacock
2018-10-31 18:58:02

That all being said, if you think there's real value or portions of that that could be added, I'd love to get invovled!

Andrew Peacock
2018-10-31 18:58:04

involved **

nhojpatrick
2018-11-28 12:47:52

gherkin.IGherkinDialectProvider is in gherkin 5.1.0, but in the 6.x releases it‚Äôs been removed. 1) what replaced it? 2) what branches of cucumber work or should work with gherkin 6.x?

as had a few issues week with people using cucumber 4.2.0, and taking the latest gherkin 6.0.14 and complaining to me everything is broken‚Ä¶

long story short‚Ä¶ we have had to downgrade back to cucumber 1.2.5 because integration within IntelliJ is broken and does not fully support newer versions of cucumber

mpkorstanje
2018-11-28 13:58:09

Man. That sucks. I've finished up a migration of about 600 scenarios from 1.2.5 to 4.2.0 with little issues. Mostly test hygiene problems that made parallel execution impossible

  1. Nothing yet. But gherkin 6 won't be used in any version of cucumber JVM until it does.

  2. Please use maven/gradle to manage the dependencies. Do not manually try to guess the dependencies. Do not include transitive dependencies.

I don't understand what people were thinking there.

  1. If you have a recent release, idea support seems fine. Cucumber expression support is still limited but if migrating nothing should stop you. You can still use regex in your steps.
mpkorstanje
2018-12-01 16:19:31

The JUnit Platform is magical. Implement some bits and Cucumber works out of the box.

nhojpatrick
2018-12-02 05:35:14

mpkorstanje
2018-12-02 07:49:08
