Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:05:46

I‚Äôm making some changes in cucumber-messages to use oneof bytes string for an attachment body. And put media_type as another field and completely get rid of the Media type.

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:19:51

Cool

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:20:50

Renamed legacy to vintage . We're still using this stuff. So in historical clothing terms gherkin 5 is more like jeans with holes in it then bear skins.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:40:34

Oh yeah I like vintage! I‚Äôm a vintage jeans fan too!

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:41:16

Turns out protobufjs doesn‚Äôt handle conversion of bytes fields to JSON correctly, which is a bit annoying - I‚Äôll have to code around it somehow.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:43:01

The Java implementation (which I assume is more battle tested) converts the bytes [1,2,3,4] to "\u0001\u0002\u0003\u0004" while the javascript implementation turns it into base64: AQIDBA==.

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:48:17

Wow.

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:48:32

Both suck

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:49:18

I guess most people use the binary representation, so the json representation is inconsistently implemented

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:49:49

That wouldn't surprice me. Maybe it's feature of Gson that you need to turn on

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:50:29

Yeah I‚Äôm taking a deep dive. If we can choose between the two I think base64 is better since it‚Äôs more compact.

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:51:51

Yeah. Safer too

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:54:54

PEBCAK - they both do base64

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:58:13

Ah. Lets remove both the chair and keyboard then. üòÑ

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 08:58:33

Or should we deprecate them first?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 08:58:47

/dev/null

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 09:54:34

@Aslak Helles√∏y the new development branch is now:

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/tree/gherkin8

I'm going to try to merge the prep work branch with gherkin-vintage only -- make that pass.

Then tomorrow I'm going to sort out how to merge the gherkin-messages part.

Then after that we can sort out the TCK and message formatter.

But since that is all still unfinished I'm keeping that out of any MR's

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 09:55:43

Take note that I did a force push on the prep work branch

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 10:00:14

The reason for splitting it up like this:

It keeps the MRs focused on a few goals and that makes reviewing them easier.

In this case: ‚Ä¢ Provide predictable id infra ‚Ä¢ Gherkin compatiblity layer ‚Ä¢ Formatters use compatibilty layer Gherkin 8 will be ‚Ä¢ Provide Gherkin 8 support (with the exception of html and json formatters) Messages ‚Ä¢ Implement protobuf message formatter ‚Ä¢ Pass the TCK.

mpkorstanje
2019-12-12 10:01:52

So effectively this means that I'll be taking a step back from Cucumber messages and focus on finishing the previous two components first.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2019-12-12 10:19:24

That sounds good @mpkorstanje. On the monorepo/cck side I‚Äôm fixing the attachment messages to support binary attachments, renaming contenttype to mediatype like we talked about.

Then I‚Äôll add a --cck option to fake-cucumber which will use: ‚Ä¢ Predictable UUIDs (incrementing int) ‚Ä¢ Predictable clock ‚Ä¢ Portable error formatter (keep message, exclude stack trace)

‚úîÔ∏è mpkorstanje
Tim te Beek
2019-12-15 00:39:07

quick suggestion for an administrator: when you open up cucumber-jvm in github, at the top of the page you see a "Used by 2.8K" figure.. and while that's impressive already, that only shows projects that depend on cucumber-core .. if you select cucumber-junit you can see there's 11.9K users: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/network/dependents?package_id=UGFja2FnZS0xODczMDg1Nzk%3D Github allows you to change the number displayed, to correctly show the impact the project is having: https://github.blog/changelog/2019-08-15-users-can-now-choose-the-package-displayed-in-used-by/

The GitHub Blog
Users can now choose the package displayed in Used By - The GitHub Blog
The Used By feature shows a badge at the top of public repositories which indicates how many repositories are known to depend on a public package published by this repository. In repositories that publish multiple
Original URL: https://github.blog/changelog/2019-08-15-users-can-now-choose-the-package-displayed-in-used-by/
mpkorstanje
2019-12-15 03:58:11

*Thread Reply:* Cheers!

I've set it to cucumber-java to make it consistent with the maven badge and because bigger numbers are better.

Though all in all I think it is a worthless feature. You get to see 10K+ of peoples test projects.

The maven central download statistics are much more interesting.

2019-12-15 10:38:39

Anton Deryabin
2020-01-11 07:31:40

mpkorstanje
2020-01-11 07:33:03

*Thread Reply:* The regular gherkin:5.2.0 one

mpkorstanje
2020-01-11 07:33:52

Anton Deryabin
2020-01-11 07:36:10

Doug
2020-01-13 04:33:02

mpkorstanje
2020-01-16 02:58:43

Released Cucumber-JVM v5.0.0. It will hit Maven central in a few hours.

Don't have blog access any more so you can now find the release notes here:

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/master/release-notes/v5.0.0.md

RELEASE_NOTES.md
<pre><code>Release Notes ============= ## Cucumber-JVM v5.0.0 Last year [we announced v5.0.0-RC1]. Today we're announcing v5.0.0! This release was made possible by significant contributions and test driving from - in no particular order; Anton Deriabin, Alexandre Monterroso, Marit Van Dijk and David Goss, Dominic Adatia, Marc Hauptmann, John Patrick and Lo√Øc P√©ron. We'll cover some of notable changes since the announcement of v5.0.0-RC1. As always the [full changelog] can be found in the repository. [we announced v5.0.0-RC1]: &lt;https://cucumber.io/blog/announcing-cucumber-jvm-v5-0-0-rc1/&gt; [full changelog]: CHANGELOG.md ### Empty cells in data tables In RC1 we already introduced a change that would convert empty cells to `null` values rather then the empty string. However there are use cases where an empty string is actually desired. By declaring a table transformer with a replacement string it becomes‚Äå ‚Äåpossible to explicitly disambiguate between the two cases. For‚Äå ‚Äåexample: ‚Äå ```gherkin Given some authors | name | first publication | | Aspiring Author | | | Ancient Author | [blank] | </code></pre> <pre><code>package &lt;a href="http://com.example.app"&gt;com.example.app&lt;/a&gt;; import io.cucumber.java.DataTableType; import io.cucumber.java.en.Given; import java.util.List; public class StepDefinitions { @DataTableType(replaceWithEmptyString = "[blank]") public Author convert(Map&amp;lt;String, String&amp;gt; entry){ return new Author( entry.get("name"), entry.get("first publication") ); } @Given("some authors") public void given_some_authors(List&amp;lt;Author&amp;gt; authors){ // authors = [Author(name="Aspiring Author", firstPublication=null), Author(name="Ancient Author", firstPublication=)] } } </code></pre> <h3>Sharing the Spring Application Context</h3> <p>The <code>cucumber-spring</code> module provides dependency injection using the Spring application context. The application context can take a long time to start up so Springs <code>TestContextManager</code> framework will share identical application contexts between tests. </p> <p>However to use step definitions Cucumber has to modify the application context. When executing in parallel step definitions were registered concurrently and this resulted in several race conditions. So as a workaround Cucumber would create a new application context for each thread.</p> <p>Some sleuthing by Dominic Adatia uncovered the root cause of the race conditions and a solution to solve it properly. As an additional benefit Cucumber will also share the application context with other unit tests improving performance somewhat more.</p> <h3>Deprecating <code>--non-strict</code></h3> <p>In most frameworks tests can either be skipped, failed, or succeed. In Cucumber, they can also be pending or undefined. Tests that are skipped or succeeded do not fail the build. But depending on your opinion of work-on-in-progress, pending and undefined test might.</p> <p>Cucumber facilitates provides the <code>--strict</code> and <code>--non-strict</code> execution options which makes work in progress fail or pass respectively. This flexibility comes at a cost. Tools that interpet Cucumbers output also have to be configured with either the --strict or the --non-strict option and these configurations have to be consistent.</p> <p>While <code>--non-strict</code> has been the default for a long time we are now of the opinion that work in progress is a failing state. This means that in proper TDD fashion when given a feature file, it will not pass until all steps have been implemented and made to pass (note: Cucumbers generated step definitions throw a pending exception). To make this transition graceful Cucumber will log a warning when using --non-strict. The warning can be suppressed by using <code>--strict</code>. Eventually we'll remove the <code>--non-strict</code> option and make <code>--strict</code> the default behaviour.</p> <h3>JUnit 5 Support</h3> <p>Cucumber-JVM now has JUnit5 support. To use it add the <code>cucumber-junit-platform-engine</code> dependency to your project. ‚Äå</p> <pre><code>&amp;lt;dependency&amp;gt; &amp;lt;groupId&amp;gt;io.cucumber&amp;lt;/groupId&amp;gt; &amp;lt;artifactId&amp;gt;cucumber-junit-platform-engine&amp;lt;/artifactId&amp;gt; &amp;lt;version&amp;gt;${cucumber.version}&amp;lt;/version&amp;gt; &amp;lt;scope&amp;gt;test&amp;lt;/scope&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/dependency&amp;gt; </code></pre> <p>You can provide options by adding a <code>junit-platform.properties</code> file to your classpath root. Below are the supported options. ‚Äå</p> <pre><code>cucumber.ansi-colors.disabled= # true or false. default: true cucumber.execution.dry-run= # true or false. default: false cucumber.glue= # comma separated package names. example: com.example.glue cucumber.plugin= # comma separated plugin strings. example: pretty, json:path/to/report.json cucumber.object-factory= # object factory class name. example: com.example.MyObjectFactory cucumber.snippet-type= # underscore or camelcase. default: underscore cucumber.execution.parallel.enabled= # true or false. default: false cucumber.execution.parallel.config.strategy= # dynamic, fixed or custom. default: dynamic cucumber.execution.parallel.config.fixed.parallelism= # positive integer. example: 4 cucumber.execution.parallel.config.dynamic.factor= # positive double. default: 1.0 cucumber.execution.parallel.config.custom.class= # class name. example: com.example.MyCustomParallelStrategy </code></pre> <p>Altogether your project should look like this. ‚Äå</p> <pre><code>‚îú‚îÄ pom.xml or build.gradle ‚îú‚îÄ src/main/java/ | ‚îî‚îÄ com/example/app/ | ‚îî‚îÄ Application.java ‚îú‚îÄ src/test/java/ | ‚îî‚îÄ com/example/app/ | ‚îî‚îÄ ApplicationStepDefinitions.java ‚îî‚îÄ src/test/resources/ ‚îú‚îÄ junit-platform.properties ‚îî‚îÄ com/example/app/ ‚îî‚îÄ application.feature </code></pre> <p>‚Äå For more details see the [junit-platform-engine/README.md].</p> <h4>Tooling Support</h4> <p>So Cucumber has JUnit5 support. What does this actually mean and how do I run my features? JUnit5 consists of three parts. The JUnit Platform, JUnit Jupiter, and JUnit Vintage. The JUnit Platform is a framework to develop test engines. Examples of these would be JUnit Jupiter and JUnit Vintage. </p> <p>Cucumber implements the JUnit Platform API. Any one using Cucumber and the JUnit Platform will be able to discover, filter and execute feature files as if they were just another test. As Cucumber now implements a popular API it should be easier to integrate with build systems and IDEs.</p> <h4>Running with the Console Launcher</h4> <p>The JUnit 5 project provides a <code>ConsoleLauncher</code>. You can use this to run Cucumber. See the [JUnit5 documentation] for details. This will ouput something like this. ‚Äå ``` ‚ï∑ ‚îî‚îÄ Cucumber ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îú‚îÄ A feature with scenario outlines ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ A scenario ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ A scenario outline ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ With some text ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ Example #1 ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ Example #2 ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ With some other text ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ Example #1 ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ Example #2 ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ A scenario outline with one example ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ Examples ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ Example #1 ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ Example #2 ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îî‚îÄ A feature with a single scenario ‚úîÔ∏è ‚îî‚îÄ A single scenario ‚úîÔ∏è</p> <p>Test run finished after 2588 ms [ 8 containers found ] [ 0 containers skipped ] [ 8 containers started ] [ 0 containers aborted ] [ 8 containers successful ] [ 0 containers failed ] [ 8 tests found ] [ 0 tests skipped ‚Ä¶</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
üéâ Vincent Pretre, Benjamin Bischoff, Aslak Helles√∏y, Anton Deryabin, Ervins Patmalnieks, Tim te Beek

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:01:23

Hi @mpkorstanje - I had a look at the message formatter for Cucumber-JVM. For lambda stepdefs, a stepdef is reported for every scenario (as opposed to only once for class stepdefs)

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:01:44

I was looking at the same thing just right now.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:01:45

I understand why this is happening, but I think we should still only emit it once.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:02:08

Let me paste what I was writing:

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:02:24

Conceptually it is the same stepdef even if it is registered once for each scenario

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:03:14

So I was looking at some of the differences in the event streams generated by the CCK and JVM. Differences in ID and timestamp aside I think the CCK and JVM have different execution models.

In JVM a step definition is tied to a type registry which in turn is tied to a feature file (because of the localization when parsing numbers). Other cucumber implementations don't do this.

As a result each scenario has its own set of step definitions in JVM where as they're global in the CCK (and other Cucumber implementations). This isn't limited to just Java 8, but also to regular annoation based step definitions.

And because the event includes the pattern we also can't emit them just once. When dealing with a different locale the generated pattern will be different.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:04:06

Hum

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:04:28

This makes it difficult to use the diff-based approach to compare messages

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:04:46

I think we should evaluate alternative validation strategies

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:05:32

Not just difficult. The difference in execution model means that these are incompatible implementations. An alternative validation strategy would be so weak as to provide no value at all.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:05:52

That depends on the validation strategy üôÇ

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:06:11

I have a couple in mind

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:07:05

The first one would be to pass the messages through one of the standalone message based formatters, and compare the output of that. For example cucumber-json-formatter .

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:09:24

Another, complementary validation strategy could be to validate the messages against the petri net Vincent and I worked on a few months ago. I ended up extracting that stuff into a little tool, and I also presented it at a conference: ‚Ä¢ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qr3YUC7G6KA&feature=youtu.be ‚Ä¢ https://github.com/cucumber/petrinet

YouTube
Codurance (https://www.youtube.com/user/codurance)
Aslak Hellesoy: TDD with Petri Nets - SCL Conf 2019
Original URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qr3YUC7G6KA&amp;feature=youtu.be
cucumber/petrinet
<p>Petri Net simulation and diagramming</p>
Language
<p>Ruby</p>
Last updated
<p>3 months ago</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/petrinet">cucumber/petrinet</a>
mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:12:29

That doesn't sound quite right. The stand alone for-matter and petri-net implementation would still have know how to deal with the step definition events from both JVM and other implementations.

I don't think that hiding a part of the standard in the implementation of a tool used to validate it is the right way to go.

I think it might be better to say that step definitions can happen at any time, but always before the execution of the step they define.

I guess we could implement that by reordering the events in canonical order and put the step definitions first.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:12:51

So in essence, change the standard.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:14:46

The petri net model would capture what you said (stepdefs must be defined before execution) and I think we can model it in a way that it works for different implementations.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:15:47

Still, I think a more straightforward way to validate output would be to send it through some of our message processors and check the output of that

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:16:41

Of course, that would make it harder to run in Java, as these formatters aren‚Äôt written in Java

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:20:32

> Still, I think a more straightforward way to validate output would be to send it through some of our message processors and check the output of that That is implicit though and quite possibly leaves allot of wiggle room. Testing against a consumer is a good test to see if the protocol is useful but it doesn't really describe the protocol in a way a third party can implement against it.

> The petri net model would capture what you said (stepdefs must be defined before execution) and I think we can model it in a way that it works for different implementations. Okay so we'd have two tests.

  1. Validating the contents of an event (once for each event)
  2. Validating the order of an event streams > Of course, that would make it harder to run in Java, as these formatters aren‚Äôt written in Java I'm okay with running the acceptance tests in the mono repo against a fixed version of cucumber-jvm rather then the other way around. The feedback loop will be slow but it's better then no feedback at all.
mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:22:33

When it comes to running the tests. What ever works, works.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:28:39

Okay. I think I've got most of the data table example to pass now.

If I ignore all differences in IDs, timestamps and event order I'm only looking at difference between the ndjson implementation in javascript and java.

And some missing testStepId .

I'll fix those those first.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:30:52

Here is an idea then. For each standalone formatter, we validate that they can process messages from different Cucumber implementations. This would be easier if Cucumbers add the generated messages to git.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:31:40

For example, cucumber-json-formatter would run against Cucumber-X‚Äôs output of the CCK features

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:33:49

We could do this for all implementations and verify that what they generate is ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:36:33

I dunno. I think we're thinking to far ahead still. I'd like to have one passing test first for a few implementations and then see what the damage is. Once we know what we need to compromise and relax our constraints to make one test pass we can define that as the standard.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:39:01

We're still in the complex domain, not the complicated one.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:39:33

If the JSON formatter or HTML formatter can‚Äôt process messages from Cucumber-JVM, that‚Äôs a problem, so I think we need to do this regardless.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:40:18

It may not be the best way to validate Cucumber-JVM, but it‚Äôs still a good way to detect incompatibilities

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:41:09

When we find a problem, the solution may require a change to the message schema, fix a bug in the producer, or in the consumer. It depends.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:41:28

Yeah. But order matters. I think we're going wide to quickly.

Ideally we'd start with 1 feature file, 1 step definition, 1 step, 1 scenario and try to make that work for JVM, Ruby, Js, the HTML formatter, ect.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:43:31

Right now we have scenarios for attachments, data tables, hoops and stack traces, which is great for finding all sorts of complications but nothing for the simplest example. So we can't really iterate.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:44:21

We can't do green-red-green.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:45:59

I can create a new one called step-definitions which is a single scenario with a single step/stepdef (no parameter types)

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:46:16

Then that gives us a basis for something simple

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:48:51

Lets do that. Then I'll try to come up with a way to run jvm snapshots in the mono repo so we can run the tests in comparisons in one place. We can try to extract that later again if we want to.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:50:30

For example - this works:

./dist/cucumber-json-formatter-darwin-amd64 --format ndjson &lt; ../../compatibility-kit/javascript/features/data-tables/data-tables.ndjson

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:50:50

This does not:

./dist/cucumber-json-formatter-darwin-amd64 --format ndjson &lt; ../../compatibility-kit/javascript/features/attachments/attachments.ndjson

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:51:04

So we have a bug somewhere

mpkorstanje
2020-01-17 06:51:12

Lets get that to work for step-definitions.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:51:23

That‚Äôs valuable information for me - tells me where to work next

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-01-17 06:51:47

Just waiting to merge https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/860 then I‚Äôll do step-definitions

aslakhellesoy (https://github.com/aslakhellesoy)
#860 Cucumber query rewrite
<p>I have rewritten the query objects and split them up. They are now more focussed, and I believe, simpler. They are also more decoupled so it should be easier to use with Markdown in the future. The React components have also been simplified a little, adding a new <code>&amp;lt;Wrapper&amp;gt;</code> component that sets up query objects and creates the necessary contexts.</p>
Labels
language: javascript, library: cucumber-query, library: cucumber-react
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>

2020-01-30 03:44:26

Was also able to easily upgrade 45 projects here! Really love the junit platform runner for easy parallel test runs.. only minor issue seems that failsafe log output order is off now.. inter mixed scenarios/steps :/

mpkorstanje
2020-01-30 03:51:43

*Thread Reply:* You mean the log capture by failsafe or the xml? I don't think they're really supporting either yet for JUnit.

Tim te Beek
2020-01-30 04:41:16

*Thread Reply:* Just explored a

Tim te Beek
2020-01-30 04:41:40

*Thread Reply:* Bit further.. it's likely the output from the pretty plugin that's inter mixed..

Tim te Beek
2020-01-30 04:42:15

*Thread Reply:* Can confirm the XML files lack any output other that assertion failure..

Tim te Beek
2020-01-30 04:43:03

*Thread Reply:* So the pretty plugin determination of whether to buffer output before pushing to stdout might need to be updated..

mpkorstanje
2020-01-30 07:24:44

*Thread Reply:* That was intentional. Pretty formatter only has to be pretty when writing in serial. When executed in parallel I only want to preserve the happened before relationship between log lines.

mpkorstanje
2020-01-30 07:26:24

*Thread Reply:* It used to be a facsimile of the original feature file but we dropped that to because its too complicated for no good purpose.

Tim te Beek
2020-01-30 09:58:42

*Thread Reply:* That explains it.. thanks. Not an issue, just something I noticed now aside from the way faster tests.. :)

make release``` Almost a a 1 liner. Only need to unlock the GPG key prior to starting the release and automate deleting empty sections in the changelog.

mpkorstanje

mpkorstanje
2020-02-12 01:25:14

*Thread Reply:* Thanks!

mpkorstanje
2020-02-13 07:04:37

*Thread Reply:* @bearded.qa unfortunately the behavior is as intended.

Optional capture groups always are always null when absent. Unfortunately a null can be happily converted to false. As a result a step definition like (true|false)? could not accurately represent the fact that there was no value set at all. For other primitives it meant straight up null pointer exceptions.

The behavior you were using would in fact be a bug. However I can't reproduce a working version in v4.8 as you mentioned either.

mpkorstanje
2020-02-13 07:27:31

*Thread Reply:* Please clone the java skeleton to your own space. The skeleton is also used as part of our docs so its kinda sloppy to use it for reproducers.

bearded.qa
2020-02-13 21:59:39

*Thread Reply:* Ok, thanks for checking that. I'll remember about the skeleton. Also thanks for fast fixing 1892. Cheers.

Tim te Beek
2020-02-21 03:50:14

colleague reported an interesting issue today.. in upgrading from 5.1.3 tot 5.4.0 they suddenly noticed jackson-databind was now reported as test scoped dependency.. turns out they were using the cucumber-jvm parent pom.xml as Maven BOM import, and it overruled the scope for the otherwise spring boot parent managed dependency.. should the docs be updated to reflect that the root pom is not to be used as BOM import? of should we offer a proper BOM now that test-scoped-jackson-databind rules out usage as BOM?

mpkorstanje
2020-02-21 04:19:13

*Thread Reply:* Well I do find this to be all sorts of amusing. Anything I can't prevent people from using will be used. Inappropriately so. :D

Typically a bill of materials has the -bom suffix and there is nothing indicating or suggesting that cucumber-jvm is in fact a bill of a materials. So I suspect documenting that it isn't a bill of materials will do us little good.

Tim te Beek
2020-02-21 04:24:36

*Thread Reply:* yup; I was also surprised and somewhat amused by this unexpected usage.. would adding a BOM help perhaps? since "typical" usage quickly involves a few dependencies such as java8/junit/platform-engine.. I could see how people like to manage the dependency versions in one place.. (although I'm doing that just fine with a maven property myself)

mpkorstanje
2020-02-21 04:26:57

*Thread Reply:* I'm thinking of turning the parent pom into something that can function as a bom

mpkorstanje
2020-02-21 04:27:35

*Thread Reply:* May not be quite what you want/need but it should at-least avoid non-test non-cucumber related dependencies.

Tim te Beek
2020-02-21 04:29:09

*Thread Reply:* that could help as well, provided the parent pom.xml wouldn't override non-cucumber dependencies

mpkorstanje
2020-02-21 04:31:53

*Thread Reply:* We'll have to set JUnit dependencies because we interface with these.

Tim te Beek
2020-02-21 04:35:25

*Thread Reply:* understandable.. I think it's mostly the databind scope that tripped things up here.. although I could see using the parent pom.xml as BOM might also lead to more subtle versioning issues when applied incorrectly..

Tim te Beek
2020-02-21 04:35:45

*Thread Reply:* you wouldn't want your project library dependency version numbers to be managed by a test dependency BOM, for instance..

mpkorstanje
2020-02-21 04:37:04

*Thread Reply:* https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/1900

Let me know what you think.

mpkorstanje (https://github.com/mpkorstanje)
#1900 [All] Remove Jackson from `cucumber-jvm` parent pom
<p>The <code>cucumber-jvm</code> parent pom included <code>jackson-databind</code> in its dependency<br /> management section. Because this is a test only dependency it was marked as<br /> test scoped.</p> <p>While not intended to function as a bill of materials people were and perhaps<br /> still are using <code>cucumber-jvm</code> in this fashion. Removing <code>jackson-databind</code><br /> from the dependency management ensures that <code>cucumber-jvm</code> only manages<br /> cucumber and test related dependencies.</p> <p><strong>Types of changes</strong></p> <p>‚òëÔ∏é Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue). ‚òê New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality). ‚òê Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected).</p>
Milestone
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/milestone/8">5.x.x</a>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
mpkorstanje
2020-02-21 04:37:36

*Thread Reply:* I'm still considering the possibility of adding a bom but I'd have to study that a bit more.

2020-02-21 04:38:31

*Thread Reply:* I recon #1900 would work.. I'll pass it along to the colleague to gather some feedback

Benjamin Bischoff
2020-02-28 02:20:40

Hi all, is there a way to get a consolidated timeline report when you use multiple runner classes? If I point each one of them to a separate directory, I get separate timeline reports for all (that's expected). If I point the output of all to the same directory, they get overwritten (also expected but unfortunate).

mpkorstanje
2020-02-28 04:13:49

*Thread Reply:* No. That's not possible at all.

Benjamin Bischoff
2020-02-28 04:16:39

*Thread Reply:* Alright, thought so. Thanks for the confirmation.

Benjamin Bischoff
2020-02-28 04:18:05

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 01:17:26

Hi everyone! Have there been any major changes to the Backend mechanism between 4.7.X and the current 5.X release?

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 01:17:54

*Thread Reply:* We're using SPI now to load backends.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 01:18:11

*Thread Reply:* So you don't have to put a backend in the cucumber.runtime package anymore.

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 01:18:33

*Thread Reply:* ok thanks - I would like to migrate the OAS/Swagger Backend I created for 4.7.X to the latest version - that shouldn't be too difficult...

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 01:18:36

*Thread Reply:* anything else?

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 01:18:49

*Thread Reply:* the interface is still the same?

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 01:19:59

*Thread Reply:* No, but effectively yes.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 01:20:20

*Thread Reply:* Check the existing implementation. You'll need a BackendProviderService implementation for the SPI.

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 01:20:30

*Thread Reply:* ok thanks - will do that

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 06:04:44

*Thread Reply:* ok - running into problems here - in the 4.7 version I was able intercept the actual mapping of pickles to arguments - which allowed me to dynamically parse a Given OAS definition and add corresponding stepdefs - in 5.x this parsing/mapping of pickles to arguments/teststeps has been moved away from the Backend/Glue interfaces into core functionality that doesn't seem to be extensible...

ultimately what I want to do is extract "Given the OAS definition at ..." statements from scenarios - parse the specified definitions - and define StepDefinitions dynamically from those before the scenario is executed..

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 06:05:36

*Thread Reply:* any ideas on how I could achieve that in 5.x? (happy to walk you through some code if that helps understand...)

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 06:06:42

*Thread Reply:* (I was intercepting StepDefinition.matchedArguments in 4.7)

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 06:29:35

*Thread Reply:* Rather then intercepting existing step definitions you could register your own step definitions to do that.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 06:29:55

*Thread Reply:* I don't have time for walk through but we could schedule a thing on Thursday

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 06:30:40

*Thread Reply:* ok - and could a stepdefinition add new stepdefinitions dynamically when it is executed?

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 06:31:59

*Thread Reply:* No, that won't work unfortunately but you could you make them generic enough to route them to the right action when the step is invoked?

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 06:36:37

*Thread Reply:* well - i could just have a single stepdefinition that maps to "(.**)" and then do all parsing/execution myself - but that feels like I would be duplicating a lot of logic in cucumber core

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 06:38:50

*Thread Reply:* Okay. A little less generic but still somewhat generic.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 06:38:58

*Thread Reply:* üòÑ

Ole Lensmar
2020-03-04 06:39:46

*Thread Reply:* üòÑ

2020-03-04 06:39:50

mpkorstanje
2020-03-04 06:41:23

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:31:58

Hi @mpkorstanje - got a minute?

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:32:07

Yeah sure.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:32:29

As I‚Äôm improving the URLOutputStream I‚Äôm stumbling over a lot of things I‚Äôd like to fix in the plugin architecture.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:32:48

*Thread Reply:* I know the feeling. üòÑ

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:32:53

We‚Äôre allowing many different ctor arg types: String, File, URL, URI, Appendable

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:33:19

How about only supporting File, Writable, OutputStream as ctor args

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:33:40

I think that would simplify things a lot

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:34:00

But as I‚Äôm writing that I realise it might break backwards compat‚Ä¶.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:35:05

That's what I had in mind. And I don't even want to to do OutputStream.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:35:29

Why not?

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:36:02

Unclear ownership. I'd rather have that plugins implement Closable which we invoke after Cucumber stops.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:36:22

Then they can clean up everything they've setup themsellves.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:36:39

Oh, so you mean not support Writable and OutputStream

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:36:48

Yeah. Neither.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:37:07

Only. String, File, URI.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:37:27

Or maybe only just String.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:37:32

And instead offer a static utility method the plugin can call:

Writer writer = makeWriter(someStringPassedToCtor)

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:38:08

Hell no. I don't want to maintain a utility class. Plugin authors can sort that out themsevles.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:38:48

Fair enough. Ok, I‚Äôll go with that.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:39:19

But yeah. That breaks backwards compatibility to remove it now. However you can only use the String ctor.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:40:53

What about STDOUT?

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:41:24

Good point.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:41:25

It should be possible to specify one formatter without explicit output and have STDOUT passed to it

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:41:37

Beware of this hobgoblin btw:

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/master/core/src/main/java/io/cucumber/core/plugin/PluginFactory.java#L38

core/src/main/java/io/cucumber/core/plugin/PluginFactory.java:38
<pre><code> static URL toURL(String pathOrUrl) { </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:42:09

That‚Äôs nuts

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:42:45

Yeah. We're doing some input correction halfway through the process.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:43:40

Maybe we should back up a bit though. You wanted to fix the URLOutputStream but I'd suggest only improving its internals.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:43:53

How about this: Formatters who want to be able to write to STDOUT can declare 2 constructors. One taking File|String|URI and one for PrintStream

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-05 06:44:20

The factory will only call the PrintStream one if it decided it can have STDOUT.

mpkorstanje
2020-03-05 06:46:05

I'd let it rest for now. Something for the next major version.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-03-09 04:56:38

#922 cucumber-html/java: Add Java implementation
<p><strong>Summary</strong></p> <p>Java implementation of <code>cucumber-html</code>.</p> <p>TODO:</p> <p>‚òëÔ∏é remove the .js and .css from ‚òëÔ∏é Main should write to STDOUT rather than requiring a file argument. ‚òëÔ∏é make the jar executable ‚òëÔ∏é setup a subrepo ‚òëÔ∏é Setup a build job ‚òëÔ∏é Run acceptance tests after build ‚òê Make acceptance test and cleaning acceptance test part of java/default.mk</p> <p><strong>Details</strong> <strong>Motivation and Context</strong> <strong>How Has This Been Tested?</strong> <strong>Screenshots (if appropriate):</strong> <strong>Types of changes</strong></p> <p>‚òê Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue). ‚òëÔ∏é New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality). ‚òê Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected).</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>‚òê My change requires a change to the documentation. ‚òê I have updated the documentation accordingly. ‚òê I have updated the CHANGELOG accordingly.</p>

Buddy5
2020-04-06 00:44:54

Hi All,

I have the below queries on implementations.

I am using cucumber with selenium project with Maven dependencies, I am using Extended cucumber class for report genertation and retry logic stuff.

Problem I am facing here is I am unable to use newer version of cucumber which supports the @BeforeStep and AfterStep since I am getting no backend support error on using the latest version of cucumber along the the cucumber extended class i.e I am using @RunWith(ExtendedCucumber.class) along with the cucumber-java latest version dependencies. I thought that the current version of cucumber is not compatibl ewith the ExtendedCucumber class So I am using info.cuckes version of cucumber 1.2.5 (Maven Dependency)

Queries:

  1. Its possible to implement @BeforeStep and @AfterStep annotations in the earlier version like 1.2.5?
  2. Its possible to get the each step name and the step execution status in the cucumber in 1.2.5 version since I am unable to implement latest version in my project ?

Peter

@Peter has joined the channel

Akshat Nigam
2020-04-13 08:28:09

@Akshat Nigam has joined the channel

Akshat Nigam
2020-04-13 08:31:03

Hi, I was using new cucumber-jvm with java8. And I was wondering why shouldn't we introduce a World object by default in cucumber-jvm And make cucumber-java8 LambdaGlue methods to accomodate world objects too... with great @FunctionalInterface support like supplier and consumer... I agree, not everyone uses cucumber that extensively that they need to split their stepdefs and share the state between stepdefs using world objects, but most does use it to split and reuse stepdefs.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-13 08:34:35

*Thread Reply:* I'm not sure.

If you're using any one of the DI containers you can inject a world object, or use more fine grained objects to share state between step defs.

Because the world object is passed to the constructor it is availble in the lambda of the step definition.

I'm not sure how you'd improve on this. Could you give an example?

Akshat Nigam
2020-04-13 08:46:02

*Thread Reply:* Well actually, I am using DI but not a container. I am using it through Dagger2, although no official cucumber-DI extension is there for Dagger2, I am achieving the same by extending cucumber's ObjectFactory.

It is working quite well actually. I am continuously playing with it and came up with some ideas, through which I can make my stepdefs shorter. In some cases, only a line short, see below for example: When("I create a new user", userService::create); I was also able to reduce the cross-cutting concern of having a try-catch in every step by using an abstract class for all stepdef classes.

But then, in some complex cases, package-private access of LambdaGlueRegistry limited me to do more enhancements with world objects. So, I thought there can be some enhancements made in the library itself as per cucumber spec around state and world objects.

Note: I am using Dagger with Cucumber and not another DI container, because I am using the same for my project to achieve DI, as I don't want runtime Dependency Injection.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-13 08:49:49

*Thread Reply:* Ah cool. Glad you're extending the ObjectFactory.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-13 08:50:11

*Thread Reply:* > I was also able to reduce the cross-cutting concern of having a try-catch in every step by using an abstract class for each stepdef. Why do you need that?

Akshat Nigam
2020-04-13 08:53:23

*Thread Reply:* For asserting exceptions! Without it, I had to put try-catch around every StepDefinitionBody . And store caught exception in a World, so I can compare it with expected type of exception. It was 5 line of code for every step. Too much code to write, if you have hundreds of steps.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-13 08:57:33

*Thread Reply:* That is interesting. Do you have an example of that?

Akshat Nigam
2020-04-13 09:00:39

*Thread Reply:* Yeah, I'd be glad to show. üòä I have a whole project with full setup. But that's an enterprise project for a client. So, I can't show that. But I will be doing the same setup in another open-source project I will be doing soon, I will showcase how I am using it.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-13 09:01:54

*Thread Reply:* You don't have to show me a full blown project. A few key examples will do.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-13 09:02:43

*Thread Reply:* I know there are quite some limitations to the current setup and and its a slow crawl to untangle it all.

So yeah. I'd be really interested in seeing it.

Akshat Nigam
2020-04-13 09:03:56

*Thread Reply:* Yeah, ok. I'll be free this weekend. I'll create some examples and show here.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-13 09:04:52

*Thread Reply:* No rush.

2020-04-25 09:22:55

Hi @mpkorstanje I noticed 6.0.0.RC.1 doesn‚Äôt include the meta message when run from junit

mpkorstanje
2020-04-25 09:26:23

*Thread Reply:* context.emitMeta(); if (multiThreadingAssumed) { plugins.setSerialEventBusOnEventListenerPlugins(bus); } else { plugins.setEventBusOnEventListenerPlugins(bus); } You've put meta emission prior to the connection of the event bus

mpkorstanje
2020-04-25 09:26:54

*Thread Reply:* I would kinda expect that you'd call emitMeta from within startTestRun btw.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-25 09:27:00

*Thread Reply:* Otherwise you still have to add it in every runner

2020-04-25 09:29:00

mpkorstanje
2020-04-26 15:11:55

Benjamin Bischoff
2020-04-25 11:01:47

Hello all, is there a concrete timeline when the new Cucumber messages replace the JSON format. Asking for a friend üòÑ

mpkorstanje
2020-04-25 11:26:55

*Thread Reply:* No. No timeline yet.

Given how fundamental this formatter is though, I don't think we'll be rid of it soon.

mpkorstanje
2020-04-25 11:27:49

*Thread Reply:* So a year, if not more. But it's hard to make predictions.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-04-26 08:34:47

*Thread Reply:* When/if we remove it, people who still need JSON reports can generate it by piping messages into https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/json-formatter

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-04-26 08:36:05

*Thread Reply:* This is a command line program

Benjamin Bischoff
2020-04-27 00:01:16

*Thread Reply:* Ah this is nice. However, I would like to support the new format as soon as possible üôÇ

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-04-27 02:05:57

*Thread Reply:* Yeah there is more info in the new format. It‚Äôs a bit harder to process the new format. We may want to port the following to other languages:

‚Ä¢ https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/blob/master/gherkin/javascript/src/Query.ts ‚Ä¢ https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/query

These libraries make it easier to query a stream of messages

gherkin/javascript/src/Query.ts
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>
Benjamin Bischoff
2020-04-27 02:11:20

query/javascript/src/Query.ts:102
<pre><code> return pickleStepIds.reduce( </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>
Vincent Pretre
2020-06-23 02:08:09

*Thread Reply:* reduce is a way to walk and populate an array

Vincent Pretre
2020-06-23 02:10:06

*Thread Reply:* this code would be equivalent to this:

const testStepResults = [] pickleStepIds.forEach(pickleId =&gt; { testStepResults.push(this.testStepResultsByPickleStepId.get(pickleId)) }) return testStepResults

Benjamin Bischoff
2020-06-23 02:10:29

Vincent Pretre
2020-06-23 02:10:52

*Thread Reply:* oups, .concat instead of .push as its a list

Vincent Pretre

*Thread Reply:* but hopefully you get the idea üôÇ

üëç Tim te Beek, Benjamin Bischoff
‚úä Aslak Helles√∏y
Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-06-25 05:29:21

Is it correct that our shaded dependencies (such as com.eclipsesource.minimal-json:minimal-json) are compile dependencies? Doesn't that tell consumers that they need to download and put this dependency on the classpath even though we have shaded it into our jar?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-06-25 05:35:14

*Thread Reply:* I'm wondering if it would be more correct to declare all shaded dependencies as runtime ? Or is the dependency removed automatically? I find http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-shade-plugin/shade-mojo.html rather hard to understand.

mpkorstanje
2020-06-25 05:55:24

*Thread Reply:* 1. The maven jar plugin creates the jar file as normally. This jar file comes with a pom with that references your minimal-json as a compile time dependency.

  1. The maven shade plugin then creates a shaded version of this jar file. This will include the contents of the minimal-json jar file. This shaded version of the jar comes with a pom that no longer includes the minimal-json dependency.
mpkorstanje
2020-06-25 05:57:04

*Thread Reply:* So compile is fine. But it is also the default so it doesn't have to be mentioned.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-06-25 07:24:51

*Thread Reply:* Thanks for explaining @mpkorstanje!

mpkorstanje

2020-06-26 05:05:18

This is the sort of problem I like.

Reading a file in a jar with UTF-8 encoding:

```String JSONPATH = "/io/cucumber/gherkin/gherkin-languages.json"; BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(GherkinDialectProvider.class.getResourceAsStream(JSONPATH), UTF_8)) while (true ){ String line = reader.readLine();

if(line == null) {
    break;
}
println(line);

}``` Prints:

"then": [ "** ", "?? ", "?????? " ], "when": [ "** ", "?????? " ] } But the file it self

"then": [ "** ", "‡§Æ‡§ó ", "‡§§‡•á‡§µ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ " ], "when": [ "** ", "‡§ú‡•á‡§µ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ " ] } And it's not because UTF-8 is the wrong encoding. Or because I'm not specifying the encoding somewhere.

ü§î Tim te Beek
mpkorstanje
2020-06-26 05:43:48

*Thread Reply:* ```println("Default Charset=" + Charset.defaultCharset()); println("Default Charset in Use=" + new OutputStreamWriter(new ByteArrayOutputStream()).getEncoding()); System.out.println("‡§ú‡•á‡§µ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ"); new PrintStream(System.out, true, "UTF-8").println("‡§ú‡•á‡§µ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ");

Default Charset=US-ASCII Default Charset in Use=ASCII ?????????????????? ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ``` Well there is hint.

mpkorstanje

*Thread Reply:* The problem is that java treats file names as strings with an encoding rather then bytes.

üëå Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
Quang Le
2020-07-12 05:43:08

Hi forks, I want to discuss alittle bit about PicoFactory. Currently it only allow us to use addClass. But to me it's not enough. addClass only help me to instantiate objects using default constructors. But sometime I want my objects to be instantiated using static methods (using a Factory etc,..). How can I achieve such a thing?

Quang Le
2020-07-12 05:45:20

I've tried to modify PicoFactory, to have it call PicoContainer's addComponent(Object), along with addComponent(Class), but it's alittle bit messy

mpkorstanje
2020-07-12 07:29:40

*Thread Reply:* The default implementation only supports constructor DI. This is rather simple but intentionally so. I would suggest wrapping the classes that don't have constructors.

mpkorstanje
2020-07-12 07:38:30

*Thread Reply:* If you want something more complicated it may be worth looking at guice instead.

mpkorstanje
2020-07-12 07:38:57

*Thread Reply:* Or you can remove cucumber-picocontainer from your dependencies and implement your own ObjectFactory that always includes some component when started.

Btw. I don't think you'd have to call addComponent twice.

mpkorstanje
2020-07-12 07:39:53

*Thread Reply:* ObjectFactory implementations are discovered via SPI and part of Cucumbers API so that should be a relatively safe thing to do.

Quang Le
2020-07-12 20:12:05

*Thread Reply:* ok, I will let cucumber-picocontainer as it be, I've tried to modify it but the behaviors is quite unexpected

Quang Le
2020-07-12 20:12:23

*Thread Reply:* i will take a look at guice, thank you so much

mpkorstanje
2020-09-04 14:49:41

Anybody object to a new patch version of Cucumber JVM on Monday?

(Mostly double checking because I'm not the only one who's been making changes recently).

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-09-05 04:18:38

Thanks for asking @mpkorstanje. That would be great. Are you confident https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/2109 won't introduce any backwards-incompatible changes?

mpkorstanje (https://github.com/mpkorstanje)
#2109 [Core] Separate run, dry-run and skip execution modes
<p>Given a scenario with several steps:</p> <pre><code>Scenario: Given a passed step And a skipped step And an pending step And an undefined step And an ambiguous step </code></pre> <p>When executing this the outcome of the result is:</p> <pre><code>a passed step -&amp;gt; PASSED a skipped step -&amp;gt; SKIPPED an pending step -&amp;gt; PENDING an undefined step -&amp;gt; SKIPPED an ambiguous step -&amp;gt; AMBIGUOUS </code></pre> <p>This is wrong, because after the first non-passed result all other steps should be skipped. So:</p> <pre><code>a passed step -&amp;gt; PASSED a skipped step -&amp;gt; SKIPPED an pending step -&amp;gt; SKIPPED an undefined step -&amp;gt; SKIPPED an ambiguous step -&amp;gt; SKIPPED </code></pre> <p>When using executing this scenario with <code>--dry-run</code> the result is:</p> <pre><code>a passed step -&amp;gt; PASSED a skipped step -&amp;gt; PASSED an pending step -&amp;gt; PASSED an undefined step -&amp;gt; UNDEFINED an ambiguous step -&amp;gt; AMBIGUOUS </code></pre> <p>And surprisingly enough this is also wrong. While the skipped and pending states can only be detected by executing an implemented step, the undefined step should be marked as undefined and the ambiguous step that follows it should be skipped.</p> <pre><code>a passed step -&amp;gt; PASSED a skipped step -&amp;gt; PASSED an pending step -&amp;gt; PASSED an undefined step -&amp;gt; UNDEFINED an ambiguous step -&amp;gt; SKIPPED </code></pre> <p>The cause for this confusion lies in the fact that <code>--dry-run</code> was implemented using the skip mechanism rather then its own execution mode that is distinct from both a regular run and skip mode. By implementing these as individual execution modes we can avoid this confusion.</p> <p>Implementing this however revealed that our formatters were often being tested with completely undefined scenarios. This does not provide a representative test and allowed <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2102">#2102</a> to come into existence. Fixing this was rather complicated, the formatters were being tested with an overly complicated mock implementation. Replacing this mock implementation with stubs made the tests more readable and removed a significant chunk of complexity.</p> <p>Fixes: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2102">#2102</a></p>
Comments
2
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
mpkorstanje
2020-09-05 06:24:28

*Thread Reply:* I think it will be alright. It only affects undefined/ambiguous steps.

The change looks big but that's mostly because I refactored all the formatter tests to be more readable.

brasmusson
2020-09-06 10:44:19

@mpkorstanje From https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/2109 ```When using executing this scenario with --dry-run the result is:

a passed step -> PASSED a skipped step -> PASSED an pending step -> PASSED an undefined step -> UNDEFINED an ambiguous step -> AMBIGUOUS

And surprisingly enough this is also wrong. Really. I think this is the correct behavior. From the issue which #2109 fixes "<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2102>" [test] that validates if all steps have been implemented``` I would rephrase that as "all steps can be executed". Undefined step and Ambiguous steps cannot be executed. That information should always be reviled in the step result. That way dry run can be used to achieve what #2102 is requesting - a complete list of all step that cannot be executed - either because they are undefined or because they are ambiguous.

If I should define rules for undefined/ambiguous steps it would be: "Undefined/Ambiguous steps shall always have the result Undefined/Ambiguous - in regular mode, in dry run mode, and in skip mode"

#2109 [Core] Separate run, dry-run and skip execution modes
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
#2102 Cucumber6 won't fail on non-existing step in dryRun
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
mpkorstanje
2020-09-06 12:56:54

*Thread Reply:* This does make sense but it also makes interpreting Cucumbers results quite complicated.

Currently we can use the rule that the most severe result of all steps is the result of the scenario.

So during normal execution I would expect that when a scenario is aborted using one of the recognized exceptions that the scenario result is skipped.

And it came as a surprise to me that after aborting the test, if any steps were undefined/ambigious Cucumber would fail the scenario instead.

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/core/src/main/java/io/cucumber/core/runner/TestStep.java#L28

Now we could use the rule that the result of the scenario is the first non-passing step but that would be confusing again because now the scenario could be skipped when it contains ambiguous/undefined steps.

By aborting the test execution after the first non-passing step we can satisfy both expectations because all steps after the first non-passing step will be skipped.

core/src/main/java/io/cucumber/core/runner/TestStep.java:28
<pre><code> private static final String[] TEST_ABORTED_OR_SKIPPED_EXCEPTIONS = { </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
mpkorstanje
2020-09-06 13:00:05

*Thread Reply:* > [test] that validates if all steps have been implemented This requires only one step in each scenario to be identified. While it would be convenient to identify all at once JUnit and TestNG can only report one exception per test and most people will consume Cucumbers feedback directly through these.

However, for undefined steps we do report all undefined steps with the first exception because the exception collects the undefined step events.

mpkorstanje
2020-09-06 13:00:25

*Thread Reply:* So this leave ambigious steps. Perhaps we can do the same thing for ambigious steps that we do for undefined steps.

mpkorstanje
2020-09-06 13:20:49

*Thread Reply:* I've posted some more thoughts on github

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/2109#issuecomment-687890739

One improvement I would consider though is also emitting ambiguous step events. That way we can report all ambiguous and undefined steps in a single exception and we don't have to throw the AmbiguousStepDefinitionsException from the AmbiguousPickleStepDefinitionsMatch.

seb
2020-09-08 02:36:46

We‚Äôre in the process of releasing 6.6.1

üëç mpkorstanje
seb
2020-09-08 03:21:30

The release process has completed.

mpkorstanje
2020-09-08 03:30:17

*Thread Reply:* That took longer then expected. Did everything work out correctly?

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-09-08 03:57:52

*Thread Reply:* We had a timeout the first time and had to redo it manually

mpkorstanje
2020-09-08 04:02:00

*Thread Reply:* Ah that sucks.

mpkorstanje
2020-09-13 12:58:25

FYI: I'm looking to make a new release of Cucumber-JVM after I've merged:

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/2121

That should hopefully unstuck:

https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-227508

mpkorstanje (https://github.com/mpkorstanje)
#2121 [JUnit Platform] Support discovery selectors with FilePosition
<p>There was no good way to discover and execute a single test when using a file<br /> based test system like Cucumber. Recently JUnit added support for file position<br /> in the <code>FileSelector</code> and <code>ClasspathResourceSelector</code>.</p> <p>See: <a href="https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/2146">junit-team/junit5#2146</a></p> <p>This implements a filter that prunes all scenarios that do not match the<br /> <code>FilePosition</code> from the discovery selector. This feature itself is not new. It<br /> was already implemented for the <code>UriSelector</code>.</p> <p>This feature will benefit the implementation of <a href="https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-227508">IDEA-227508</a>. If you would like to use this feature in the future please up up-vote it.</p> <p>TODO:</p> <p>‚òê Create demo project for the benefit of the IDEA people.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>

2020-09-14 06:08:13

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2020-09-15 03:12:28

*Thread Reply:* No worries. That sounds great. I'll do it :)

Aslak Helles√∏y
2020-09-15 03:36:17

*Thread Reply:* After I've added you to keybase you should be able to release by following the instructions here: https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm-scala/blob/main/RELEASING.md

Thanks @mpkorstanje for setting that up!

RELEASING.md
<pre><code>Releasing ========= The deployment process of `cucumber-jvm-scala` is based on [Deploying to OSSRH with Apache Maven](&lt;http://central.sonatype.org/pages/apache-maven.html#deploying-to-ossrh-with-apache-maven-introduction&gt;). ## Check [![Build Status](&lt;https://travis-ci.org/cucumber/cucumber-jvm-scala.svg?branch=main&gt;)](&lt;https://travis-ci.org/cucumber/cucumber-jvm-scala&gt;) ## Is the build passing? </code></pre> <p>git checkout main</p> <pre><code> Also check if you can upgrade any dependencies: </code></pre> <p>make update-dependency-versions</p> <pre><code> ## Decide what the next version should be ## Versions follow [Semantic Versioning](&lt;https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html&gt;). To sum it up, it depends on what's changed (see `CHANGELOG.md`). Given a version number MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH: ** Bump `MAJOR` when you make incompatible API changes: ** There are `Removed` entries, or `Changed` entries breaking compatibility ** A cucumber library dependency upgrade was major ** Bump `MINOR` when you add functionality in a backwards compatible manner: ** There are `Added` entries, `Changed` entries preserving compatibility, or `Deprecated` entries ** Bump `PATCH` when you make backwards compatible bug fixes: ** There are `Fixed` entries Display future version by running: </code></pre> <p>make version</p> <pre><code> Check if branch name and version are as expected. To change version run: </code></pre> <p>mvn versions:set -DnewVersion=X.Y.Z-SNAPSHOT</p> <pre><code> ## Secrets ## Secrets are required to make releases. Members of the core team can install keybase and join the `cucumberbdd` team to access these secrets. During the release process, secrets are fetched from keybase and used to sign and upload the maven artifacts. ## Make the release ## Check if branch name and version are as expected: </code></pre> <p>make version</p> <pre><code> Do the release: </code></pre> <p>make release</p> <pre><code> All done! Hurray! </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm-scala">cucumber/cucumber-jvm-scala</a>

I wouldn't know how many people use --threads though.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-03-02 03:54:54

@Benjamin Bischoff I thought maybe this would be of interest to you? https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/1394

aslakhellesoy (https://github.com/aslakhellesoy)
#1394 Cucumber JSON Test Corpus
<p>Each Cucumber implementation that produces JSON reports does so inconsistently because the JSON format <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/messages#lack-of-a-schema">does not have a schema</a>.</p> <p>To make it easier to test tools that consume Cucumber JSON we would like to have a corpus of JSON documents generated by different Cucumber implementations and versions.</p> <p>There is an existing corpus in <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/json-to-messages">json-to-messages</a>. They are not in git, but generated by running <code>make</code>.</p> <p>The proposal is to:</p> <p>‚Ä¢ Add JSON documents to Git to make them easier to consume without having to run any build commands ‚Ä¢ Move them out of <code>json-to-messages</code> to a separate <code>json-corpus</code> directory (separation of concerns) ‚Ä¢ Use <code>make</code> to orchestrate the (re)generation of JSON files when needed ‚Ä¢ Base the corpus on feature files defined in <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/compatibility-kit">compatibility-kit</a></p> <p>This corpus would be used to test <code>json-to-messages</code> as well as some proprietary tools built in SmartBear. The same corpus could be used to test any tool that consumes Cucumber JSON, so we hope to get input from the community here.</p>
Labels
‚úÖ accepted, üîß build, json-to-messages
Comments
1
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">cucumber/cucumber</a>

mpkorstanje
2021-04-03 16:40:48

@Aslak Helles√∏y what do you think about this? I think this should solve most of the problems we've had with cucumber-java8 and should provide a migration path away from cucumber-java8. I totally stole the name from your suggestion to rename cucumber-java8 btw. üòÑ

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2279

mpkorstanje (https://github.com/mpkorstanje)
#2279 Implement cucumber-lambda as a replacement for cucumber-java8
<p><code>cucumber-java8</code> allows step definitions to be defined as lambda's. This is really useful because it removes the need to type your step definition twice as you would with <code>cucumber-java</code>. So using lambda's to define step definitions is really useful.</p> <p>Compare:</p> <pre><code>Given("A gherkin and a zukini", () -&amp;gt; { }); @Given("A gherkin and a zukini") public void a_gherkin_and_zukini(){ } </code></pre> <p>Unfortunately lambda's must be defined in the constructor of a step definition class. As a result we can not know which step definitions are defined until a Cucumber scenario has started. This makes it impossible to discover, cache and validate step definitions up front, preventing us from making Cucumber more efficient (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2035">#2035</a>).</p> <pre><code>public class StepDefinitions { public StepDefinitions(){ Given("A gherkin and a zukini", () -&amp;gt; { }); } } </code></pre> <p>Additionally <code>cucumber-java8</code> does not work on on OpenJDK 12+ (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1817">#1817</a>) because it has to determine the types of a lambda on Java 8-11 by fishing in the constant pool. This is no longer allowed in Java 12+ and <code>typetools</code> is unlikely to receive updates that make this possible. Fortunately <a href="https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/334">JEP 334</a> introduced an API for this.</p> <p><strong>Requested solution</strong></p> <ol><li>Implement <code>cucumber-lambda</code> as an alternative for <code>cucumber-java8</code> that uses a DSL to build step definitions. Because this DSL is created in a static field it can be discovered in the same way <code>cuucmber-java</code> discovers step definitions.</li> </ol> <pre><code>public class CucumberLambdaStepDefinitions { @Glue public static CucumberLambda glue = CucumberLambda .using(World.class) .step("A gherkin and a zukini", (World world) -&amp;gt; () -&amp;gt; { world.setGherkins(1); world.setZukinis(1); }) .step("{int} gherkin(s) and {int} zukini(s)" -&amp;gt; (World world) -&amp;gt; (int gherkins, int zukinis) -&amp;gt; { world.setGherkins(gherkins); world.setZukinis(zukinis); }); // repeat for hooks, parameter types and data table types, ect </code></pre> <ol start="2"><li>Build and compile <code>cucumber-lambda</code> with Java 12 and use JEP 334 to determine the lambda types.</li><li>The <code>World</code> object is created using DI as usual. Consider the possibility of defining steps/hooks using multiple objects.</li> </ol> <pre><code>CucumberLambda .using(GherkinPatch.class, ZukiniPatch.class) .step("A gherkin and a zukini", (gherkinPatch, zukiniPatch) -&amp;gt; () -&amp;gt; { }); </code></pre> <p><strong>Out of scope</strong></p> <ol start="4"><li>Generate localized vairations of the DSL that use Given/When/Then.</li> </ol> <pre><code> @Glue public static CucumberLambda glue = io.cucumber.lambda.en.CucumberLambda .using(World.class) .given("A gherkin and a zukini", (World world) -&amp;gt; () -&amp;gt; { world.setGherkins(1); world.setZukinis(1); }) .when("{int} gherkin(s) and {int} zukini(s)" -&amp;gt; (World world) -&amp;gt; (int gherkins, int zukinis) -&amp;gt; { world.setGherkins(gherkins); world.setZukinis(zukinis); }); // ect. </code></pre>
Labels
üôè help wanted, ‚ö° enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
mpkorstanje
2021-04-15 23:55:14

Aur√©lien Reeves
2021-04-29 05:05:48

@Aur√©lien Reeves has joined the channel

Aur√©lien Reeves
2021-04-29 05:19:44

I am setting-up my dev environment for cucumber-jvm. I've installed IntellJ IDEA on Windows.

I have been able to mvn install -DskipTests=true -DskipITs=true -Darchetype.test.skip=true -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -B -V Now I am trying to mvn verify -P-spotless-apply

I have the following error message: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:mavensurefireplugin:2.22.2:test (default-test) on project cucumber-core: There are test failures. Deepak
2021-05-12 09:06:15

In gherkin github, I found a test class which imports classes from io.cucumber.messages.types . However I couldn't find those classes in any of the cucumber libraries. Can someone help me understand, which library to be used for same. https://github.com/cucumber/gherkin-java/blob/master/src/test/java/io/cucumber/gherkin/GherkinDocumentBuilderTest.java

<https://github.com/cucumber/gherkin-java/blob/master/src/test/java/io/cucumber/gherkin/GherkinDocumentBuilderTest.java | GherkinDocumentBuilderTest.java>
<pre><code>package io.cucumber.gherkin; import io.cucumber.gherkin.pickles.PickleCompiler; import io.cucumber.messages.IdGenerator; import io.cucumber.messages.types.Comment; import io.cucumber.messages.types.FeatureChild; import io.cucumber.messages.types.GherkinDocument; import io.cucumber.messages.types.Pickle; import io.cucumber.messages.types.TableRow; import org.junit.Test; import java.util.List; import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals; public class GherkinDocumentBuilderTest { private final IdGenerator idGenerator = new IdGenerator.Incrementing(); @Test public void is_reusable() { Parser&amp;lt;GherkinDocument&amp;gt; parser = new Parser&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(new GherkinDocumentBuilder(idGenerator)); TokenMatcher matcher = new TokenMatcher(); GherkinDocument d1 = parser.parse("Feature: 1", matcher); GherkinDocument d2 = parser.parse("Feature: 2", matcher); assertEquals("1", d1.getFeature().getName()); assertEquals("2", d2.getFeature().getName()); } @Test public void parses_rules() { Parser&amp;lt;GherkinDocument&amp;gt; parser = new Parser&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(new GherkinDocumentBuilder(idGenerator)); String data = "" + "Feature: Some rules\n" + "\n" + " Background:\n" + " Given fb\n" + "\n" + " Rule: A\n" + " The rule A description\n" + "\n" + " Background:\n" + " Given ab\n" + "\n" + " Example: Example A\n" + " Given a\n" + "\n" + " Rule: B\n" + " The rule B description\n" + "\n" + " Example: Example B\n" + " Given b"; GherkinDocument doc = parser.parse(data); List&amp;lt;FeatureChild&amp;gt; children = doc.getFeature().getChildren(); assertEquals(3, children.size()); IdGenerator idGenerator = new IdGenerator.Incrementing(); PickleCompiler pickleCompiler = new PickleCompiler(idGenerator); List&amp;lt;Pickle&amp;gt; pickles = pickleCompiler.compile(doc, "hello.feature"); assertEquals(2, pickles.size()); assertEquals(3, pickles.get(0).getSteps().size()); assertEquals(2, pickles.get(1).getSteps().size()); } @Test public void parses_just_comments() { Parser&amp;lt;GherkinDocument&amp;gt; parser = new Parser&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(new GherkinDocumentBuilder(idGenerator)); GherkinDocument doc = parser.parse("" + "# Just a comment"); List&amp;lt;Comment&amp;gt; children = doc.getComments(); assertEquals(1, children.size()); } @Test public void sets_empty_table_cells() { Parser&amp;lt;GherkinDocument&amp;gt; parser = new Parser&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(new GherkinDocumentBuilder(idGenerator)); GherkinDocument doc = parser.parse("" + "Feature:\n" + " Scenario:\n" + " Given a table\n" + " |a||b|" ); TableRow row = doc.getFeature().getChildren().get(0).getScenario().getSteps().get(0).getDataTable().getRows().get(0); assertEquals("a", row.getCells().get(0).getValue()); assertEquals("", row.getCells().get(1).getValue()); assertEquals("b", row.getCells().get(2).getValue()); } } </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/gherkin-java">cucumber/gherkin-java</a>

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2021-05-14 05:00:57

Hello folks, Scala 3 has just been released, thus I would like to offer a Cucumber Scala compatible version in the coming days (main work already done in a dedicated branch). But I have a versioning question: bringing support to Scala 3 requires breaking changes in Cucumber Scala which I would like to reflect by bumping the version from 6.x to 7.x. However, until now Cucumber Scala has always been following Cucumber Core/JVM versions and this would result in a Cucumber Scala 7.x relying on Cucumber Core 6.x. I personally don't mind as long as it's documented clearly (in the README for instance) but this could be confusing maybe? Another option would be to release an intermediate Cucumber Scala milestone 7.0.0-M1 for instance and wait for Cucumber Core 7.x to release a "final" Cucumber Scala 7.x version. Any opinion on this? ü§∑

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-05-14 05:02:44

*Thread Reply:* I think the right thing to do here is to bump Cucumber Scala to 7.x. I don't think it's practical to try to keep the version numbers in sync since they are now independent projects with their own release cycle.

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2021-05-14 05:11:42

*Thread Reply:* Makes sense, thx for the feedback Aslak üôÇ

üëç Aslak Helles√∏y
Deepak
2021-05-14 10:42:02

import io.cucumber.gherkin.GherkinDocumentBuilder; import io.cucumber.gherkin.Parser; import io.cucumber.gherkin.TokenMatcher; import io.cucumber.messages.IdGenerator; import io.cucumber.messages.Messages.GherkinDocument;

public class SampleGherkinDocumentBuilderTest { private final static IdGenerator idGenerator = new IdGenerator.Incrementing();

`public static void main(String[] args) {`
    `Parser&lt;GherkinDocument&gt; parser = new Parser(new GherkinDocumentBuilder(idGenerator));`
    `TokenMatcher matcher = new TokenMatcher();`

    `GherkinDocument d1 = parser.parse("Feature: 1", matcher);`
    `GherkinDocument d2 = parser.parse("Feature: 2", matcher);`

    `System.out.println(d1.getFeature().getName());`
    `System.out.println(d2.getFeature().getName());`
`}`

}

Above codes ends up with class io.cucumber.messages.Messages$GherkinDocument$Builder cannot be cast to class io.cucumber.messages.Messages$GherkinDocument (io.cucumber.messages.Messages$GherkinDocument$Builder and io.cucumber.messages.Messages$GherkinDocument are in unnamed module of loader 'app')

Can someone please help me understand what am I missing?

Deepak
2021-05-17 01:52:29

Is there a way can we assign some Aliases to a Step definition? I am trying to mimic @Alias available in Jbehave.

When the feature files being prepared by different teams, the statements changes sometimes keeping the same meaning .

E.g. Feature: DB Feature

Scenario: Scenario 1 Given I connect to DB When I execute Query Then It will not result any record.

Scenario: Scenario 2 Given I connect to DB When I execute Query Then Zero record It will return as result.

Here Scenario 1 and 2 explains same validation but for execution, we need to create 2 different step definition for Then . Is there a way, can we create only one step definition with both the step expression?

2021-05-17 01:55:46

@Aur√©lien Reeves I've closed this one. Chasing problems in 1.x and 2.x is a never ending story. Best if people upgrade to the latest.

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2333

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2333|#2333 cucumber step definition snippet issue .>
<p>Description:-</p> <p>On executing feature file step definition snippet is not coming to the console.</p> <p><strong>To Reproduce</strong><br /> Steps to reproduce the behavior:</p> <ol><li>select the project and open feature file and run it as cucumber feature.</li> </ol> <p>eclipse console output:-</p> <pre><code>Feature: Login test feature Scenario: Test Flipkart login page. # C:/Users/HP/eclipse-workspace/CucumberSelenium/src/test/java/Features/login.feature:3 Given: Navigate to the login page. When: login with valid "username" and "password" Then: click on login button. And: Capture the home page. 0 Scenarios 0 Steps 0m0.000s </code></pre> <p>In above output step definition snippet suggestion is missing.</p> <p>+++++++++++++++++++++pom.xml file+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++</p> <pre><code>&amp;lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?&amp;gt; &amp;lt;project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd"&amp;gt; Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:24:31

Hi all!

please excuse me if I'm asking this on the wrong channel

We've been using Cucumber 2.4.0 for a long time and we've made some extensions in order for (among other stuff) dynamic injection of "glue" code, depending on the "scenario" type

As of today (cucumber 6.11), the RuntimeOptions.getGlue() method returns a unmodifiableList so we can't add (at runtime) a new item to that list

I'm not a huge expert on Cucumber but was unable to find a workaround or different way of doing this, so I resorted to asking here

Thanks in advance, I can explain the ways we use this in our test framework

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:27:06

*Thread Reply:* What are you trying to achieve by dynamically adding glue classes?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:28:33

*Thread Reply:* some examples, if you add a tag @browser, we make a Selenium web browser "appear" on the classpath without business projects needing to invoke it

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:30:16

*Thread Reply:* Have you considered using conditional hooks?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:30:19

*Thread Reply:* with this, some business projects can add glue code to implement some GWT standard phrases in their own test libraries

this avoids circular dependencies in some cases

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:31:26

*Thread Reply:* imagine someone knows how to deal with application login, that can be implemented once and auto injected to all tests where logins are necessary

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:36:18

*Thread Reply:* Conditional Hooks do not appear to be a good solution for our case

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:44:43

*Thread Reply:* How does your system work? How do you determine which additional glue classes should be added for a given scenario?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:47:36

*Thread Reply:* we do integrated tests with Maven and JUnit4, driven by Cucumber Scenarios

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:48:21

*Thread Reply:* Okay. But you mentioned that previously you were adding glue classes to the RuntimeOptions.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:48:32

*Thread Reply:* How did you do that and how did you work out which scenarios needed the extra glue?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:50:04

*Thread Reply:* we created an ExtendedCucumber module with a plugin system

and within each plugin we add the appropriate glue code as needed

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:51:12

*Thread Reply:* How did those plugins work? How were they enabled/disabled?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:51:57

*Thread Reply:* actual code, valid for cucumber 2.4.0:

> RuntimeOptions.getGlue().add(BROWSERHOOKSPACKAGE);

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:52:22

*Thread Reply:* So you've added that for every test that would be executed?

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:52:35

*Thread Reply:* Or did you add the glue conditionally on something else?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:53:00

*Thread Reply:* we add all extension plugins into Cucumber, they get" activated" by tags

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:53:43

*Thread Reply:* So why are conditional hooks not sufficient for you? They are also activated by tags on scenarios.

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:54:07

*Thread Reply:* conditional hooks must be part of running test

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:54:39

*Thread Reply:* So why is that a problem?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:55:41

*Thread Reply:* with our approach, if someone removes, let's say, @browser tag from feature, test will fail because the Selenium browser object is not injected

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:56:35

*Thread Reply:* If the webdriver was not instantiated in a conditional hook, would the test not fail in the same way?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:56:55

*Thread Reply:* well, I'll ask another thing, why RuntimeOptions,getGlue() isn't returning a simple list and/or why is setGlue() not a public method

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 06:57:28

*Thread Reply:* Because you're using internal apis. They're not designed or intended to be used outside of Cucumber.

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:57:49

*Thread Reply:* reason being?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 06:58:33

*Thread Reply:* or maybe we just keep on using 2.4.0 since it does what we need it to do

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:00:22

*Thread Reply:* > reason being? public apis should be designed with a use case in mind. That way they can be documented and tested. This ensures they won't break unexpectedly.

Now I'm currently trying to understand your use case. However you don't seem to be very forth coming with it.

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:00:54

*Thread Reply:* I can explain further, ther's an actual use case here

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:01:46

*Thread Reply:* English is not my main language (I'm Portuguese) ans unfortunately I can't show any code as my employer doens't allow me)

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:02:40

*Thread Reply:* That's okay.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:04:20

*Thread Reply:* If you're okay with using internal apis and see things break in the future you can use RuntimeOptionsBuilder.addGlue

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:04:43

*Thread Reply:* as an example: Project G is responsible for creating and dealing with user management (all database managment for that is solely project G's responsability)

Project G provides a glue implementation of the following:

" @Given I'm authenticated "

And also implements an ExtendedCucumberPluginImpl to add that "package?" glue code

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:06:30

*Thread Reply:* Are you using Java's SPI to discover ExtendedCucumberPluginImpl?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:07:03
