Scenario: As a resident, request parking exemption from municipality

@Given I'm authenticated @When I fill out all fields @Then my request is made

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:07:41

*Thread Reply:* Project B will not need to implement "Given" line, because that's ProjectG¬´'s resposability

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:08:59

*Thread Reply:* You may perhaps not need to use ExtendedCucumberPluginImpl . In v6 when no glue is provided Cucumber scans the entire classpath. So all glue will be discovered.

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:10:44

*Thread Reply:* only if you declare dependencies to all implementing modules

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:12:19

*Thread Reply:* I'll have to look into what you're saying right now Thing is, we, as a framework, do now control each and every aspect of any project that wishes to implement their own glue

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:12:28

*Thread Reply:* Do you mean dependencies build dependencies (in your pom.xml) or dependencies between your classes?

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:13:04

*Thread Reply:* as Project D may want to provide a specific cucumber GWT phrase to the benefit of all other projects

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:13:36

*Thread Reply:* both, we try to avoid circular deps

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:13:49

*Thread Reply:* Ah. I see.

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:13:50

*Thread Reply:* it's a VERY painful process so far

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:15:12

*Thread Reply:* we have 4 code frameworks and over 80 projects, each with their own idiosincrasies

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:16:33

*Thread Reply:* and I also understand the internal API not being fully open or expansible

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:16:40

*Thread Reply:* Fundamentally I'm not sure if the pattern you are using is a good one. You're creating predefined script steps to do things. And that's not really what Cucumber was made for.

So rather then contributing steps, it's usually better to contribute APIs and allow different teams to write feature files in their own language with as much/little detail as needed.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:18:19

*Thread Reply:* But yeah, if you want to continue on this path have a look at implementation in Cucumber.java. You can add another source of properties here, that could be the glue path from your own setup

``` // Parse the options early to provide fast feedback about invalid // options RuntimeOptions propertiesFileOptions = new CucumberPropertiesParser() .parse(CucumberProperties.fromPropertiesFile()) .build();

    RuntimeOptions annotationOptions = new CucumberOptionsAnnotationParser()
            .withOptionsProvider(new JUnitCucumberOptionsProvider())
            .parse(clazz)
            .build(propertiesFileOptions);

    RuntimeOptions environmentOptions = new CucumberPropertiesParser()
            .parse(CucumberProperties.fromEnvironment())
            .build(annotationOptions);

    RuntimeOptions runtimeOptions = new CucumberPropertiesParser()
            .parse(CucumberProperties.fromSystemProperties())
            .enablePublishPlugin()
            .build(environmentOptions);```

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/junit/src/main/java/io/cucumber/junit/Cucumber.java#L108

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/junit/src/main/java/io/cucumber/junit/Cucumber.java | Cucumber.java>
<pre><code> public Cucumber(Class&amp;lt;?&amp;gt; clazz) throws InitializationError { </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
Luis Correia

all those projects get to be deployed as a big WAR file

2021-09-08 07:20:33

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:21:13

*Thread Reply:* It might be easier if you have 80 projects in CI that each run a subset of tests.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:23:53

*Thread Reply:* Ah. Don't try to share steps. It doesn't work as well as you might think.

Luis Correia

mpkorstanje

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:28:40

*Thread Reply:* Question:

Did you copy the implementation of Cucumber.java to make the plugins work that add the extra glue.

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:29:07

*Thread Reply:* yes, we did copy

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:29:17

*Thread Reply:* Ok. One sec then.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:37:29

*Thread Reply:* The way to add extra glue:

RuntimeOptions extendedOptions = new RuntimeOptionsBuilder() .addGlue( /** add glue from runtimeOptions.getGlue() **/ ) .addGlue( /** Some glue **/ ) .addGlue( /** More glue **/ ) .addGlue( /** More glue **/ ) .build(runtimeOptions);

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:38:10

*Thread Reply:* You have to add the glue from runtimeOptions explicitly. Otherwise it gets replaced. Then you can add more glue in this builder and then build the options again.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:38:16

*Thread Reply:* Those options will have all the glue.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:38:41

*Thread Reply:* Bear in mind that these are internal apis and from what I can tell Cucumber is not really made for the way you are using it.

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:40:23

*Thread Reply:* And from what I can tell, the architecture from your test is highly concentrated and ran from inside the cluster as an application.

It usually works better to spread your tests out into semi-independent units that can be ran from a CI pipeline rather then in an environment.

It usually also works better to orchestrate your testing from the CI by connecting a pipeline to create the environment, run the tests and then tear down the environment.

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:40:45

*Thread Reply:* Cucumber is not made for many things people use it

but yeah, I get what you're saying

One way to go is to only initialize those extendedOptions after we've gathered all facts

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 07:41:09

*Thread Reply:* we can't create test environments and tear them down

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:41:41

*Thread Reply:* It really does depend on your capabilities and the organisation you are in. üòÑ

2021-09-08 07:41:47

*Thread Reply:* that's not possible at all (and I can't explain why)

mpkorstanje
2021-09-08 07:42:17

Luis Correia

> public class BrowserFactory { > > private WebDriver webdriver; > @Before(value = "@web") > public void spawnBrowser(Scenario scenario) { > webdriver = SharedBrowser.getInstance(); > webdriver.manage().deleteAllCookies(); > LoggerFactory.getLogger(scenario.getId()).warn("Browser grabbed from @web tag :)"); > } > }

Luis Correia
2021-09-08 08:44:34

*Thread Reply:* that BrowserFactory.class is added as glue to RuntimeOptions

Luis Correia
2021-09-09 03:32:03

Hey, got another question: we currently use a cucumber.json file, generated from features, regardless of actual test results. This is done in order to build documentation from features

Recently, we noticed cucumber.json generation is being phased out in favour of a reports server

is it logical to assume cucumber.json generation will disappear in future versions?

mpkorstanje
2021-09-09 04:20:25

*Thread Reply:* Can't make any promises because this is open source. But no plans yet for Cucumber-JVM and I've got a few processes that depend on the json too.

Luis Correia
2021-09-09 04:49:07

*Thread Reply:* thanks

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-09-09 05:32:18

*Thread Reply:* We recently deprecated the json formatter in cucumber-js and cucumber-ruby because we wanted to encourage the community to adopt the cucumber-messages format.

Then we un-deprecated it and decided that the JSON formatter will stay, since so many people and tools rely on it. So it will stick around for the foreseeable future.

‚Ä¢ https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#730-2021-06-17 ‚Ä¢ https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v610

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md | CHANGELOG.md>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js">cucumber/cucumber-js</a>
Luis Correia
2021-09-09 05:45:53

*Thread Reply:* that's good to know, thanks

Jeroen Kouwer
2021-09-21 14:22:47

Is this the right channel for questions like: "In Java, is using the io.cucumber.core.gherkin.feature.FeatureParser the right entry point to parse my feature file, in order to be able to forward each element of the feature file to a text-formmatting system, where each "Feature", "Rule", "Scenario", "Example", "Given", "When", etc line is enriched with special formatting instructions, and where all descriptions are forwarded "as is"? I've been looking around a little and this class¬†looks¬†promising, but the¬†code examples¬†I could find use quite complicated set-ups (at least, I think that the boilerplate like presented in those examples is rather heavy for parsing just a single file). It could also be that I'm looking at the wrong place, that this class is not intended to be used (that way)... Anyway, any help / pointer to documentation on how to parse and process **.feature files is welcome üôÇ

programcreek.com
Java Code Examples for io.cucumber.core.feature.FeatureParser
This page shows Java code examples of io.cucumber.core.feature.FeatureParser
Original URL: https://www.programcreek.com/java-api-examples/?api=io.cucumber.core.feature.FeatureParser
mpkorstanje
2021-09-22 00:33:48

*Thread Reply:* No, that's an internal utility. Currently the gherkin parser with all the complicated setup is what you need to use.

Jeroen Kouwer
2021-09-22 00:38:08

*Thread Reply:* Is there documentation available on how to do that?

mpkorstanje
2021-09-22 00:39:25

*Thread Reply:* https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/gherkin/java/src/main/java/io/cucumber/gherkin/Main.java

<https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/gherkin/java/src/main/java/io/cucumber/gherkin/Main.java | Main.java>
<pre><code>package io.cucumber.gherkin; import io.cucumber.messages.IdGenerator; import io.cucumber.messages.MessageToNdjsonWriter; import io.cucumber.messages.MessageWriter; import io.cucumber.messages.types.Envelope; import java.io.IOException; import java.util.ArrayList; import java.util.List; import java.util.stream.Stream; import static java.util.Arrays.asList; public class Main { public static void main(String[] argv) { List&amp;lt;String&amp;gt; args = new ArrayList&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(asList(argv)); List&amp;lt;String&amp;gt; paths = new ArrayList&amp;lt;&amp;gt;(); boolean includeSource = true; boolean includeAst = true; boolean includePickles = true; IdGenerator idGenerator = null; while (!args.isEmpty()) { String arg = args.remove(0).trim(); switch (arg) { case "--no-source": includeSource = false; break; case "--no-ast": includeAst = false; break; case "--no-pickles": includePickles = false; break; case "--predictable-ids": idGenerator = new IdGenerator.Incrementing(); break; default: paths.add(arg); } } if (idGenerator == null) { idGenerator = new IdGenerator.UUID(); } MessageWriter messageWriter = makeMessageWriter(); Stream&amp;lt;Envelope&amp;gt; messages = Gherkin.fromPaths(paths, includeSource, includeAst, includePickles, idGenerator); printMessages(messageWriter, messages); } private static void printMessages(MessageWriter messageWriter, Stream&amp;lt;Envelope&amp;gt; messages) { messages.forEach(envelope -&amp;gt; { try { messageWriter.write(envelope); } catch (IOException e) { throw new GherkinException("Couldn't print messages", e); } }); } private static MessageWriter makeMessageWriter() { return new MessageToNdjsonWriter(System.out); } } </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common">cucumber/common</a>
Jeroen Kouwer
2021-09-22 11:12:40

*Thread Reply:* Thanks! This helps.

Deepak
2021-09-25 11:23:02

How can I dump a GherkinDocument object to a feature file? I have a GherkinDocument object and I am looking for options to dump it to a .feature file

Aur√©lien Reeves
2021-09-26 23:25:16

It has a method to pretty print a gherkinDocument as a Feature or a markdown file

2021-10-01 06:54:43

Hi All,

I am using Cucumber with Junit and I am looking for options to run Scenarios in Parallel. Do we have this feature available for Junit? I understand it is feasible with Cucumber + TestNg but it will a tedious task to get approval to use TestNg.

mpkorstanje
2021-10-01 06:55:07

*Thread Reply:* Works out of the box with JUnit 5

mpkorstanje
2021-10-01 06:55:19

*Thread Reply:* Uses JUnit5 support for parallel execution.

mpkorstanje
2021-10-01 06:55:33

*Thread Reply:* https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/tree/main/junit#parallel-execution-with-maven

mpkorstanje
2021-10-01 06:55:49

*Thread Reply:* With Junit 4 it is up to your build framework

mpkorstanje
2021-10-01 06:55:58

*Thread Reply:* Surefire supports it, Gradle doesn't

Deepak
2021-10-01 06:56:28

*Thread Reply:* If I understand correctly, with Junit 5, I can run both Features and Scenarios in Parallel. correct?

mpkorstanje
2021-10-01 06:57:11

*Thread Reply:* All the way down to examples.

mpkorstanje
2021-10-01 06:57:20

*Thread Reply:* https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/tree/main/junit-platform-engine#parallel-execution

Deepak
2021-10-01 06:58:11

*Thread Reply:* Thanks.. Will go through that..

Deepak
2021-10-24 15:51:02

*Thread Reply:* @mpkorstanje Junit 4 says it supports parallel execution of features only. Parallel execution of scenarios and example entries for scenario outline is not possible. As our framework is fully on Junit 4, I am looking for options around that. Due to scenario parallel execution, we are finding it difficult to migrate from Cucumber 4 as a maven plugins available to achieve same. And this repo is archived since Cucumber 5.

@Aslak Helles√∏y Is there any plan to enable parallel execution of scenarios with Junit 4 in upcoming cucumber release?

mpkorstanje
2021-10-24 17:54:22

*Thread Reply:* There are no such plans. JUnit 4 simply does not support it. Consider upgrading to JUnit 5.

Alternatively while the maven plugin you are talking about is not part of Cucumber, it is open source so you could consider forking and maintaining it yourself to make it compatible with Cucumber 5.

Remember that using open source software is not free. If you have a particular use case or invested heavily in a certain setup you will have to invest time.

mpkorstanje

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-08 03:10:01

*Thread Reply:* Thanks. Is it this one? https://github.com/nimcoh0/Jdry/tree/master/jdry-cucumber-plugin

This is advocating the use of low level technical jargon in feature files. That's a practice I believe is counterproductive and contrary to the essential values of BDD.

To learn more about that - check out @seb‚Äôs article on BRIEF: https://cucumber.io/blog/bdd/keep-your-scenarios-brief/

SmartBear.com
Keep your scenarios BRIEF
Over the years that we have been using Gherkin, our approach to writing scenarios has evolved. Because Gherkin is very close to natural language it's very easy to learn, but just like writing reports or stories, it takes practice to do it well. There are three main goals that we try to keep in mi...
Original URL: https://cucumber.io/blog/bdd/keep-your-scenarios-brief/
nimrod cohen
2021-10-08 03:41:15

*Thread Reply:* i agree that it's a mix of "low level technical jargon" and "Business language" and not clean BDD but it save a lot of time and reduce the project developing cost . so to my opinion it worth it .

2021-10-08 04:42:55

2021-10-19 03:03:01

I'm chatting with someone who has defined CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_ENABLED=true in their terminal (verified with echo "value=$CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_ENABLED" which prints value=true.

When they run mvn test in cucumber-java-skeleton, nothing is published, and the usual advertising banner is printed.

Looks to me like the JVM is not picking up environment variables defined in the shell. How could that be possible?

mpkorstanje
2021-10-19 03:06:56

*Thread Reply:* The latest skeleton uses JUnit 5.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-19 03:07:48

mpkorstanje
2021-10-19 03:07:49

*Thread Reply:* See:

https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#running-tests-config-params

mpkorstanje
2021-10-19 03:08:35

*Thread Reply:* No. I didn't say that.

Try adding the properties in the junit-platform.properties

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/tree/main/junit-platform-engine#configuration-options

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-19 03:09:04

*Thread Reply:* I want to enable report publishing with an enviroment variable, not a system property.

mpkorstanje
2021-10-19 03:10:19

*Thread Reply:* Nah. If you're using the JUnit Platform, you use the JUnit Platform to get your properties. Anything else is just going to confuse people who know how to use their platform and build system.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-19 03:10:53

*Thread Reply:* The recommended, secure way to do this is with CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_TOKEN=..., but CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_ENABLED=true should also work. The reason this is the recommended approach is that it's not safe to store secrets in properties files.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-19 03:13:36

mpkorstanje
2021-10-19 03:13:56

*Thread Reply:* No. The banner references the junit-platform.properties

mpkorstanje
2021-10-19 03:30:41

mpkorstanje

mpkorstanje
2021-10-19 03:36:51

*Thread Reply:* It doesn't follow the mould of the other plugins. And we didn't make the system more flexible.

üëç Aslak Helles√∏y
Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-19 04:00:46

*Thread Reply:* I tried adding cucumber.plugin=publish to src/test/resources/junit-platform.properties but get this warning:

```org.junit.platform.commons.JUnitException: TestEngine with ID 'cucumber' failed to execute tests Caused by: org.junit.platform.commons.JUnitException: Error executing tests for engine cucumber Caused by: org.junit.platform.commons.JUnitException: Failed to transform configuration parameter with key 'cucumber.plugin' and initial value 'json:target/cucumber.json,publish' Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The plugin specification 'publish' has a problem:

Could not load plugin class 'publish'.

Plugin specifications should have the format of PLUGIN[:[PATH|[URI [OPTIONS]]]

Valid values for PLUGIN are: html, json, junit, message, pretty, progress, rerun, summary, teamcity, testng, timeline, unused, usage

PLUGIN can also be a fully qualified class name, allowing registration of 3rd party plugins. The 3rd party plugin must implement io.cucumber.plugin.Plugin Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: publish```

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-19 04:01:14

*Thread Reply:* We never registered it as a proper plugin

Aslak Helles√∏y
2021-10-19 04:15:38

*Thread Reply:* I think I'm getting a little further... I've added this to pom.xml:

&lt;configurationParameters&gt; cucumber.junit-platform.naming-strategy=long cucumber.publish.token=${env.CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_TOKEN} &lt;/configurationParameters&gt; Now the report gets published if I run CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_ENABLED=true mvn test

However, if I run just mvn test without defining the environment variable, it literally uses ${env.CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_TOKEN}, resulting in:

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îÇ Invalid CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_TOKEN: ${env.CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_TOKEN} ‚îÇ ‚îÇ Go to <https://reports.cucumber.io/profile> to get your token. ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò

üëç:skin_tone_2: matt-SmartBear
mpkorstanje
2021-11-03 06:45:41

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-android/issues/90

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-android/issues/90|#90 The implementation of this Cucumber JVM variant appears to re-implement much that should be used as-is>
<p><strong>Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong><br /> The behavior of this <code>cucumber-jvm</code> variant is poor, running every implemented scenario in a single JUnit test instance. If the instrumentation crashes, we end up with no results of any kind. It appears that instrumentation crashes are the result of resource depletion, and there's no good way to diagnose or resolve this issue.</p> <p>It's impossible to partition feature sets into separate Java classes, as the implementation stops looking for test classes as soon as it encounters the first one in the project.</p> <p>It's also exceedingly difficult to run a single scenario or feature file.</p> <p><strong>Describe the solution you'd like</strong><br /> The Android variant of <code>cucumber-jvm</code> should follow the example of other variants. Just implement a "backend service provider" for Espresso, and use the standard <code>Cucumber</code> runner in conventional JUnit test classes. The Espresso backend would be registered through the standard Java SPI (io.cucumber.core.backend.BackendProviderService), and Cucumber JUnit would take care of almost all of the details for you.</p>
Comments
1
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-android">cucumber/cucumber-android</a>
Aur√©lien Reeves

Christian Hujer
2021-12-14 18:52:24

Last week I had the delightful experience of configuring Cucumber 7.1.0 with JUnit 5.8.2 in a Kotlin project for executing the same feature files with different glues (unit test glue, component test glue, and e2e test glue). It works like a charm, exactly as expected/advertised! Thanks for making it this way! Once I have some time for it, I will blog about that.

:dancing_pickle: Jo Laing, mlvandijk
üéâ matt-SmartBear

2021-12-14 18:54:35

*Thread Reply:* src/test/resources/features ‚áê Feature files

Christian Hujer
2021-12-14 18:55:04

*Thread Reply:* src/test/resources/junit-platform.properties ‚áê just 1 entry: cucumber.publish.quiet=true

2021-12-14 18:58:33

BDD Framework for .NET - SpecFlow - Find Bugs before they happen
Bug-free development with BDD. ‚úì Automate tests in your native language ‚úì by using the easy to understand Gherkin syntax. ‚úì for .NET.

Aslak Helles√∏y
2022-01-04 16:19:05

*Thread Reply:* I'm not suggesting you switch to .NET. I'm only suggesting that you study what they have done. Some pointers: https://specflow.org/using-specflow/generating-code-behind-files-using-msbuild/ https://github.com/SpecFlowOSS/SpecFlow/tree/master/TechTalk.SpecFlow.Generator/UnitTestProvider

This would be my approach: ‚Ä¢ Pick a simple feature file with 2-3 scenarios ‚Ä¢ Hand-write a Java class that looks like what you want to generate ‚Ä¢ Start building the code generator üôÇ ‚ó¶ Parse features file with the Gherkin parser library ‚ó¶ Load hooks and step definitions using https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/java/src/main/java/io/cucumber/java/JavaBackend.java ‚ó¶ Generate code from the Feature file ASTs and the loaded step definitions/hooks Or something along those lines

BDD framework for NET
Generating Code Behind Files using MSBuild - BDD framework for NET
Since SpecFlow 1.9, your can generate the code-behind files for feature files (*.feature.cs) at compile time. To do so, you need to use a MSBuild Task. The documentation is¬†here. Pros Feature files and code-behind files are always in sync No need to check the feature.cs files into your source control system Works without Visual Studio‚Ä¶ Continue reading Generating Code Behind Files using MSBuild
Written by
Christoph
Estimated reading time
3 minutes
Original URL: https://specflow.org/using-specflow/generating-code-behind-files-using-msbuild/
<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/java/src/main/java/io/cucumber/java/JavaBackend.java | JavaBackend.java>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>

Aslak Helles√∏y
2022-03-04 05:44:25

I think we need to add a JSON parser to ci-environment - ref https://github.com/cucumber/ci-environment/issues/86. @mpkorstanje I'm reluctant to add Jackson because of its frequent CVEs, and it would also have to be shaded to avoid "DLL hell".

What's the status with Cucumber-JVM and JSON? Does it have a shaded JSON parser? Which one(s)? Jackson? GSON? minimal-json? All of them?

<https://github.com/cucumber/ci-environment/issues/86|#86 GitHub Actions SHA doesn't always work for pull requests>
<p><strong>üëì What did you see?</strong></p> <pre><code>No after property in /home/runner/work/_temp/_github_workflow/event.json: </code></pre> <p>Followed by the contents of the file:</p> <pre><code>{ "action": "opened", "pull_request": { "base": { "sha": "1c668f7546a31cfa77f486970af0d642634b6db0" }, "head": { "sha": "d79b417f8e974b9a2d5e6483845a96446695f944" } } } </code></pre> <p>(I have only included relevant properties in the JSON)</p> <p><strong>‚úÖ What did you expect to see?</strong></p> <p>I had expected to see no error, and an event payload like this:</p> <pre><code>{ "action": "synchronize", "after": "3738117e3337e54955580f4e98cf767d96b42135", "before": "06aa815724888e86f37e41e43e07b0ec1bb0ffe1" } </code></pre> <p>(I have only included relevant properties in the JSON)</p> <p>Upon further inspection, it seems both the <code>synchronize</code> event and <code>open</code> events include a <code>.pull_request.head.sha</code> property that can be used in both cases.</p> <p>This makes the Java implementation a bit more complicated since it relies on regexp matching rather than using a JSON parser. We can probably fix this by skipping pas the <code>head</code> property before we grab the <code>sha</code>.</p>
Comments
1
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/ci-environment">cucumber/ci-environment</a>
Aslak Helles√∏y
2022-03-04 05:46:13

*Thread Reply:* Gherkin uses a shaded minimal-json - would you recommend I do the same in ci-environment? https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/fd4148c1c9780f7b5cfa7c78d30ef3b009bedd68/gherkin/java/pom.xml#L90-L110

<https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/fd4148c1c9780f7b5cfa7c78d30ef3b009bedd68/gherkin/java/pom.xml | pom.xml>
<pre><code> &amp;lt;configuration&amp;gt; &amp;lt;artifactSet&amp;gt; &amp;lt;includes&amp;gt; &amp;lt;include&amp;gt;com.eclipsesource.minimal-json:minimal-json&amp;lt;/include&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/includes&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/artifactSet&amp;gt; &amp;lt;relocations&amp;gt; &amp;lt;relocation&amp;gt; &amp;lt;pattern&amp;gt;com.eclipsesource.json&amp;lt;/pattern&amp;gt; &amp;lt;shadedPattern&amp;gt;io.cucumber.gherkin.internal.com.eclipsesource.json&amp;lt;/shadedPattern&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/relocation&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/relocations&amp;gt; &amp;lt;filters&amp;gt; &amp;lt;filter&amp;gt; &amp;lt;artifact&amp;gt;com.eclipsesource.minimal-json:minimal-json&amp;lt;/artifact&amp;gt; &amp;lt;excludes&amp;gt; &amp;lt;exclude&amp;gt;META-INF/MANIFEST.MF&amp;lt;/exclude&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/excludes&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/filter&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/filters&amp;gt; &amp;lt;/configuration&amp;gt; </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common">cucumber/common</a>
Aslak Helles√∏y
2022-03-04 05:47:35

*Thread Reply:* The problem is that it's unmaintained, so any CVEs are unlikely to get fixed... https://github.com/ralfstx/minimal-json

ralfstx/minimal-json
A fast and small JSON parser and writer for Java

704

mpkorstanje
2022-03-04 05:47:56

*Thread Reply:* Minimal json is a good choice

mpkorstanje
2022-03-04 05:49:02

Aslak Helles√∏y
2022-03-21 05:14:54

I've made my first Maven Surefire PR! ‚Ä¢ https://github.com/apache/maven-surefire/pull/495 ‚Ä¢ https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SUREFIRE-2041 That PR isn't directly related to Cucumber, but I was wondering - what's the story with ordering Cucumber scenarios? How well do we support that?

<https://github.com/apache/maven-surefire/pull/495|#495 [SUREFIRE-2041] Order test classes according to -Dtest property>
<p>This is a fix for <a href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SUREFIRE-2041">SUREFIRE-2041</a>.</p> <p>It introduces a new "test" <code>TestOrder</code> which orders test classes according to the tests specified by <code>-Dtest</code>.<br /> I have verified the implementation with both a unit test and an integration test.</p> <hr /> <p>Following this checklist to help us incorporate your<br /> contribution quickly and easily:</p> <p>‚òëÔ∏é Make sure there is a <a href="https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SUREFIRE">JIRA issue</a> filed<br /> for the change (usually before you start working on it). Trivial changes like typos do not<br /> require a JIRA issue. Your pull request should address just this issue, without<br /> pulling in other changes. ‚òëÔ∏é Each commit in the pull request should have a meaningful subject line and body. ‚òëÔ∏é Format the pull request title like <code>[SUREFIRE-XXX] - Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles</code>,<br /> where you replace <code>SUREFIRE-XXX</code> with the appropriate JIRA issue. Best practice<br /> is to use the JIRA issue title in the pull request title and in the first line of the<br /> commit message. ‚òëÔ∏é Write a pull request description that is detailed enough to understand what the pull request does, how, and why. ‚òëÔ∏é Run <code>mvn clean install</code> to make sure basic checks pass. A more thorough check will<br /> be performed on your pull request automatically. ‚òëÔ∏é You have run the integration tests successfully (<code>mvn -Prun-its clean install</code>).</p> <p>If your pull request is about ~20 lines of code you don't need to sign an<br /> <a href="https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf">Individual Contributor License Agreement</a> if you are unsure<br /> please ask on the developers list.</p> <p>To make clear that you license your contribution under<br /> the <a href="http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0">Apache License Version 2.0, January 2004</a><br /> you have to acknowledge this by using the following check-box.</p> <p>I hereby declare this contribution to be licenced under the <a href="http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0">Apache License Version 2.0, January 2004</a> In any other case, please file an <a href="https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf">Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement</a>.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/apache/maven-surefire">apache/maven-surefire</a>

Luis Correia (https://cucumberbdd.slack.com/team/U02E3L60709)
<p>Hi all!</p> <p>please excuse me if I'm asking this on the wrong channel</p> <p>We've been using Cucumber 2.4.0 for a long time and we've made some extensions in order for (among other stuff) dynamic injection of "glue" code, depending on the "scenario" type</p> <p>As of today (cucumber 6.11), the RuntimeOptions.getGlue() method returns a unmodifiableList so we can't add (at runtime) a new item to that list</p> <p>I'm not a huge expert on Cucumber but was unable to find a workaround or different way of doing this, so I resorted to asking here</p> <p>Thanks in advance, I can explain the ways we use this in our test framework</p>
Original URL: https://cucumberbdd.slack.com/archives/C6RLMP3C4/p1631107471006300

2022-05-28 08:44:33

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2022-05-28 08:44:59

*Thread Reply:* This message can only appear if cucumber-spring is used

Luis Correia
2022-05-30 01:55:50

*Thread Reply:* well, other parts of my framework do include cucumber-spring (maybe from Citrus Framework Library) but I don't have any real plans to use and would like to force it to use pico-container

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2022-05-30 02:16:14

*Thread Reply:* If you can exclude the dependency, it will be easier.

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2022-05-30 02:18:00

*Thread Reply:* Otherwise, I believe you can force the DI used, see https://cucumber.io/docs/cucumber/state/#how-to-use-di, by using a META-INF/services/io.cucumber.core.backend.ObjectFactory file and content io.cucumber.picocontainer.PicoFactory

Luis Correia
2022-05-30 03:59:16

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2022-05-30 04:07:01

<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
Tim te Beek
2022-10-03 02:38:37

perhaps interesting to share here; I've started some work to do automated migrations related to cucumber-jvm; for now it (mostly) migrates cucumber-java8 lambdas to cucumber-jvm annotated methods, with some further extensions planned. figured this would be a good way to bring users along despite breaking changes; any feedback more than welcome! üôÇ

<https://github.com/openrewrite/rewrite-testing-frameworks/issues/264|#264 Further cucumber-jvm recipes and improvements>
<p>A tracking issue for a few more cucumber-jvm recipes, to get these out of my head and into a GitHub Issue.<br /> Each individually should be easy enough to contribute and check off here; whenever I or anyone finds the time.</p> <p>‚òê Replace needless-regex cucumber expressions with non-regex cucumber expressions ‚Ä¢ <code>@When("^no need for a regex here$")</code> -&gt; <code>@When("no need for a regex here")</code> ‚Ä¢ possibly even convert regexes with capturing groups to instead use <code>{}</code> ‚òê Convert <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/release-notes/v5-CHANGELOG.md#changed-6">once upon a time</a> <code>cucumber.api</code> package to <code>io.cucumber</code> ‚òê Replace <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/a/50212219">old <code>info.cukes</code> groupIds</a> with <code>io.cucumber</code> ‚òê Replace <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/cucumber-junit-platform-engine/src/main/java/io/cucumber/junit/platform/engine/Cucumber.java#L26"><code>@Cucumber</code> with <code>@Suite @SelectClasspathResource("some/path")</code></a> ‚òê Drop <code>SummaryPrinter</code> marker interface; replace with <code>Plugin</code> interface if not already present ‚òê Support method references in the cucumber-java8 to cucumber-java migration recipes</p> <p>Tagging <a href="https://github.com/mlvandijk">@mlvandijk</a> &amp; <a href="https://github.com/mpkorstanje">@mpkorstanje</a> for review &amp; further suggestions.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/openrewrite/rewrite-testing-frameworks">openrewrite/rewrite-testing-frameworks</a>
üëç mpkorstanje
üòç mlvandijk
üëç:skin_tone_2: matt-SmartBear
Tim te Beek
2022-10-17 02:37:33

*Thread Reply:* @mpkorstanje & @mlvandijk here's a write up of these automated migrations; any feedback much appreciated!

timtebeek/cucumber-jvm-upgrades
Last updated
a minute ago
Tim te Beek
2022-10-17 02:39:04

*Thread Reply:* how do you suppose we work this into the release notes? maybe a short snippet for Maven & link to the blogpost?

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/blob/main/release-notes/v7.0.0.md | v7.0.0.md>
<pre><code>Cucumber-JVM v7.0.0 =================== Another year, another major version. Below we'll discuss some notable changes in v7.0.0 As always the full change log can be found in [the usual place](../CHANGELOG.md). Cucumber Expressions v11 ------------------------ Prior to v11 [Cucumber Expressions](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-expressions/&gt;) were transformed into regular expressions using a string substitution algorithm. This algorithm had a number of edge cases. Starting with v11 the Cucumber Expressions are described by [their own grammar](&lt;https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-expressions/blob/main/ARCHITECTURE.md#grammar&gt;). This fixes various ambiguities and bugs in the way Cucumber expressions are parsed and transformed into regular expressions. This may however also break Cucumber Expressions that depend on these ambiguities. Before-All and After-All Hooks ------------------------------ The Cucumber-Java module now supports before-all and after-all hooks. This closes one of the longest-open issues our issue tracker. The hooks have 'invoke around' semantics. All before-hooks will be executed before any scenario is executed. After all scenarios have been executed all after-hooks will be executed. ```java package io.cucumber.example; import io.cucumber.java.AfterAll; import io.cucumber.java.BeforeAll; public class StepDefinitions { @BeforeAll public static void beforeAll() { // Runs before all scenarios } @AfterAll public static void afterAll() { // Runs after all scenarios } } </code></pre> <h2>JUnit 5.8 / JUnit Platform 1.8</h2> <p>The CucumberJUnit Platform Engine has been updated to 1.8. With JUnit 5.8 comes the <code>junit-platform-suite</code> engine. This engine allows the <a href="https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#test-suite">programmatic declaration of test suites</a>.</p> <p>So it is now possible to write the following JUnit 4 test:</p> <pre><code>package com.example; import io.cucumber.junit.Cucumber; import io.cucumber.junit.CucumberOptions; import org.junit.runner.RunWith; @RunWith(Cucumber.class) @CucumberOptions(glue = "com.example.application", features = "classpath:com/example/application") public class RunCucumberTest { } </code></pre> <p>As a declarative JUnit 5 test suite: </p> <pre><code>package com.example; import org.junit.platform.suite.api.ConfigurationParameter; import org.junit.platform.suite.api.IncludeEngines; import org.junit.platform.suite.api.SelectClasspathResource; import org.junit.platform.suite.api.Suite; import static io.cucumber.junit.platform.engine.Constants.GLUE_PROPERTY_NAME; @Suite @IncludeEngines("cucumber") @SelectClasspathResource("com/example/application") @ConfigurationParameter(key = GLUE_PROPERTY_NAME, value = "com.example.application") public class RunCucumberTest { } </code></pre> <p>In combination with the before-all and after-all hooks this allows for a feature-complete migration from JUnit 4. </p> <p>Unfortunately Gradle and Surefire still only provide limited support for file based tests. While Cucumber tests can be executed, the results are reported in a <code>&lt;Class Name&gt; - &lt;Method Name&gt;</code> format. As a result only scenario names or example numbers are reported. This can make for hard to read reports. </p> <p>By using <code>cucumber.junit-platform.naming-strategy=long</code> Cucumber will include the feature name in the scenario name. This makes the test results legible.</p> <p>e.g for Maven:</p> <p>```pom.xml <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId> <version>3.0.0-M5</version> <configuration> <properties> <configurationParameters> cucumber.junit-platform.naming-strategy=long </configurationParameters> </properties> </configuration> </plugin></p> <pre><code>or for Gradle: ```build.gradle.kts tasks.test { useJUnitPlatform() systemProperty("cucumber.junit-platform.naming-strategy", "long") } </code></pre> <p>Finally, the <code>@Cucumber</code> annotation has been deprecated in favour of <code>@Suite</code>. The <code>@Cucumber</code> annotated class was originally intended as a workaround for both JUnit 5's lack of suites and Gralde and Surefires inability to discover non-class based. The with the introduction of the <code>junit-platform-suite</code> the <code>@Suite</code> annotation can do both. </p> <h2>Bill of Materials</h2> <p>It's a Bill of Materials (BOM) to help keep all dependencies aligned. </p> <pre><code>&lt;dependencyManagement&gt; &lt;dependencies&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;io.cucumber&lt;/groupId&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;cucumber-bom&lt;/artifactId&gt; &lt;version&gt;${cucumber.version}&lt;/version&gt; &lt;type&gt;pom&lt;/type&gt; &lt;scope&gt;import&lt;/scope&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;/dependencies&gt; &lt;/dependencyManagement&gt; &lt;!--Then for example--&gt; &lt;dependencies&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;io.cucumber&lt;/groupId&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;cucumber-java&lt;/artifactId&gt; &lt;scope&gt;test&lt;/scope&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;dependency&gt; &lt;groupId&gt;io.cucumber&lt;/groupId&gt; &lt;artifactId&gt;cucumber-junit-platform-engine&lt;/artifactId&gt; &lt;scope&gt;test&lt;/scope&gt; &lt;/dependency&gt; &lt;/dependencies&gt; </code></pre> <h2>Support for properties in testng.xml</h2> <p>The <code>AbstractTestNGCucumberTests</code> will now pick up properties from <code>testng.xml</code>. This allows the same runner to be reused in multiple suites. For example:</p> <pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE suite SYSTEM "http://testng.org/testng-1.0.dtd" &gt; &lt;suite name="Example Suite"&gt; &lt;parameter name="cucumber.filter.tags" value="@Gherkin and not @Zucchini" /&gt; &lt;test name="Vegetable garden" preserve-order="true"&gt; &lt;parameter name="cucumber.features" value="classpath:com/example/features/vegetable"/&gt; &lt;parameter name="cucumber.glue" value="com.example.vegetables.glue"/&gt; &lt;classes&gt; &lt;class name="com.example.RunCucumberTests"/&gt; &lt;/classes&gt; &lt;/test&gt; &lt;test name="Herb garden" preserve-order="true"&gt; &lt;parameter name="cucumber.features" value="classpath:com/example/features/herbs"/&gt; &lt;parameter name="cucumber.glue" value="com.example.herbs.glue"/&gt; &lt;classes&gt; &lt;class name="com.example.RunCucumberTests"/&gt; &lt;/classes&gt; &lt;/test&gt; &lt;/suite&gt; </code></pre> <h2>DataTable API Changes</h2> <p>Datatables can be transformed into lists, maps, lists of maps and other objects using the <code>DataTable.asX</code> methods. However not all <code>asX</code> methods would use the <code>@DataTableType</code> transformers that had been defined for them.</p> <p>To avoid confusion all <code>DataTable.asX</code> methods now use a transformer. There are however a few cases where a transform should not be used (such as inside an <code>@DataTableType</code> annotated method). So to retain the old behaviour:</p><ul><li>Replace <code>DataTable.asList()</code> with -> <code>DataTable.values()</code></li><li>Replace <code>DataTable.asLists()</code> with -> <code>DataTable.cells()</code></li><li>Replace <code>DataTable.asMaps()</code> with -> <code>DataTable.entries()</code></li> </ul> <h2>Strict mode and non-strict mode options have been removed</h2> <p>Since v6 Cucumber has been executing scenarios in strict mode by default. This means that pending and undefined steps will always fail the build. This ensures that third party tools do not have to guess if pending and undefined steps should fail a test run.</p> <p>To make migration graceful the <code>--strict</code> and <code>--non-strict</code> CLI arguments and <code>cucumber.execution.strict</code> property were left in place. These have now been removed.</p> <p>```</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>

matt-SmartBear
2022-10-26 10:02:17

One of my colleagues in the security team at SmartBear has noticed there's a possible exposure to the text4Shell vulnerability in the https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-eclipse

She's made a PR to update the version of the affected library, but the build is failing.

I also tried adding Renovate to the project and got a similar error from the build.

```Error: [ERROR] 1 error: org/eclipse/tycho/p2maven/repository/P2RepositoryConnectorFactory has been compiled by a more recent version of the Java Runtime (class file version 61.0), this version of the Java Runtime only recognizes class file versions up to 55.0 Error: -> [Help 1] org.apache.maven.InternalErrorException: Internal error: com.google.inject.ProvisionException: Unable to provision, see the following errors:

1) Error in custom provider, java.lang.TypeNotPresentException: Type org.eclipse.tycho.p2maven.repository.P2RepositoryConnectorFactory not present at ClassRealm[plugin>org.eclipse.tycho:tychop2director_plugin:3.0.0, parent: jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader@277050dc] (via modules: org.eclipse.sisu.wire.WireModule -> org.eclipse.sisu.plexus.PlexusBindingModule) while locating org.eclipse.aether.spi.connector.RepositoryConnectorFactory annotated with @com.google.inject.name.Named(value="p2")`` It looks like the CI has just got out of date and suffered some bit-rot. Does anyone have time to take a look at fixing the build on themain` branch?

Terence Pan

@Terence Pan has joined the channel

Terence Pan
2023-01-22 21:07:50

Hi I had the same problem as https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/1359 and did suggestion #3 made a plugin to append the json report. But now I feel #4 is cleaner, I'm just wondering, is something like this being worked on currently or can I look into helping out with it?

mpkorstanje
2023-01-23 01:25:36

*Thread Reply:* You can help, but it won‚Äôt be a simple or short journey.

With JUnit 5 it is in theory possible to make Cucumber ‚Äútest session aware‚Äù and not finish any reports until the session is finished.

However this isn‚Äôt implemented in JUnit 5 yet.

Once implemented in JUnit 5, you would have to change Cucumbers JUNit Platform Engine implementation to make use of this.

Once implemented in Cucumber and JUnit 5, you may have to convince the Surefire team to change Surefire to use the same session for the retry test run.

This isn‚Äôt stricly necessary, you can also run JUnit 5 without Surefire, but it definitely integrates better.

mpkorstanje
2023-01-23 01:28:24

*Thread Reply:* Some links to look at:

‚Ä¢ https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/2816 ‚Ä¢ https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2672#issuecomment-1373056325

#2816 Provide mechanism for managing engine-level resources
<a href="https://github.com/junit-team/junit5">junit-team/junit5</a>
Comment on #2672 HtmlFormatter only includes retried scenarios when surefire.rerunFailingTestsCount is used
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>

*Thread Reply:* You may have to propose to do the work yourself, the JUnit 5 team has very limited bandwith though they respond well to high quality proposals followed by quality PRs.

Tim te Beek
2023-03-07 05:20:13

hi all; would Cucumber-JVM be open to adopt these recipes in a separate migration module maintained under cucumber/cucumber-jvm? I'd help out of course to transfer them over..

Tim te Beek (https://cucumberbdd.slack.com/team/UK5UJJ9CZ)
<p>perhaps interesting to share here; I've started some work to do <a href="https://github.com/openrewrite/rewrite-testing-frameworks/issues/264">automated migrations related to cucumber-jvm</a>; for now it (mostly) migrates cucumber-java8 lambdas to cucumber-jvm annotated methods, with some further extensions planned. figured this would be a good way to bring users along despite breaking changes; any feedback more than welcome! üôÇ</p>
Thread in Slack Conversation
Tim te Beek
2023-03-07 05:21:16

*Thread Reply:* there's little to maintain realistically; the recipes as they are will work without changes; at most you'd need to merge some renovate PRs once in a while

Tim te Beek
2023-03-07 05:22:22

*Thread Reply:* at Moderne we want to move towards having framework authors provide and maintain their own migration recipes, as seen with Axon last week.

AxonIQ Developer Portal
Upgrading to Axon Framework 4.7 - Automated
An update of the previous Axon Framework 4.7 blog, explaining how you can benefit from OpenRewrite recipes to automate your migration to 4.7.
Original URL: https://developer.axoniq.io/w/upgrading-to-axon-framework-4.7-automated
Tim te Beek
2023-03-07 05:23:04

*Thread Reply:* that way there's less ceremony & review when new migration recipes need to be added, as you'd be in control rather than is being gate keepers

mpkorstanje
2023-03-07 05:27:50

*Thread Reply:* Makes sense so far.

What is the rationale for keeping them under cucumber/cucumber-jvm and not cucumber/cucumber-jvm-migration ?

Tim te Beek
2023-03-07 05:30:04

*Thread Reply:* I'd think they only apply to cucumber-jvm and modules, but could be wrong; my thinking was mostly to have them released in lock step with cucumber-jvm, although that's not a hard requirement with the version-range selectors we use in the migration recipes

<pre><code> parserClasspath("io.cucumber:cucumber_java8:7.+") parserClasspath("io.cucumber:cucumber_java:7.+") parserClasspath("io.cucumber:cucumber_plugin:7.+") parserClasspath("io.cucumber:cucumber_junit_platform_engine:7.+") </code></pre>

Language

Last updated

mpkorstanje
2023-06-02 07:57:26

mpkorstanje

*Thread Reply:* > What's transferred with a repository? > When you transfer a repository, its issues, pull requests, wiki, stars, and watchers are also transferred. If the transferred repository contains webhooks, services, secrets, or deploy keys, they will remain associated after the transfer is complete. Git information about commits, including contributions, is preserved. In addition:

Has an idea to replace @Then("shows {string}") fun showsString() { // ‚Ä¶ } with @Then fun `shows {string}`() { // ‚Ä¶ } already been proposed/discussed for JVM languages that allow more freedom in function names, like Kotlin? Could save some typing (obviously only in single-annotation-cases).

Ga√´l Jourdan-Weil
2023-03-21 13:53:08

*Thread Reply:* FYI the Scala implementation uses a different approach without annotation at all. Then("shows {string}") { str: String =&gt; ... }

mpkorstanje
2023-03-21 14:15:15

*Thread Reply:* I had an API in mind that works more like scala. But it's going to be a long time before I'll make progress. You're welcome to help out.

https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2279

#2279 Consider cucumber-java-lambda as a replacement for cucumber-java8
<p><code>cucumber-java8</code> allows step definitions to be defined as lambda's. This is really nice because it removes the need to type your step definition twice as you would with <code>cucumber-java</code>. So there is a good reason to use lambda's to define step definitions.</p> <p>Compare:</p> <pre><code>Given("A gherkin and a zukini", () -&gt; { }); @Given("A gherkin and a zukini") public void a_gherkin_and_zukini(){ } </code></pre> <p>Unfortunately with <code>cucumber-java8</code> lambda's must be defined in the constructor of a step definition class. As a result we can not know which step definitions are defined until a Cucumber scenario has started and all world objects are instantiated. This makes it impossible to discover, cache and validate step definitions up front, preventing us from making Cucumber more efficient (<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2035">#2035</a>).</p> <pre><code>public class StepDefinitions { public StepDefinitions(){ Given("A gherkin and a zukini", () -&gt; { }); } } </code></pre> <p>Additionally Cucumber uses <code>typetools</code> to determine the type of lambda parameters. This requires the use of of <code>Unsafe</code> to fish in the constant pool. This is a non-trivial process and Cucumber currently uses <code>typetools</code> to facilitate this. However because this fundamentally depends on unsafe operation it is not guaranteed to work in the long run.</p> <p><strong>Requested solution</strong></p> <ol><li>Implement <code>cucumber-lambda</code> as an alternative for <code>cucumber-java8</code> that uses a DSL to build step definitions. Because this DSL is created in a static field it can be discovered in the same way <code>cuucmber-java</code> discovers step definitions and avoids the issues of <code>cucumber-java8</code>.</li> </ol> <pre><code>public class CucumberLambdaStepDefinitions { @Glue public static CucumberLambda glue = CucumberLambda .using(World.class) .step("A gherkin and a zukini", (World world) -&gt; () -&gt; { world.setGherkins(1); world.setZukinis(1); }) .step("{int} gherkin(s) and {int} zukini(s)", (World world) -&gt; (int gherkins, int zukinis) -&gt; { world.setGherkins(gherkins); world.setZukinis(zukinis); }); // repeat for hooks, parameter types and data table types, ect // hooks should be named beforeAll, beforeEach, beforeStep. </code></pre> <ol start="2"><li>Avoid the use of <code>typetools</code> where possible by specifying all parameter types</li><li>The <code>World</code> object is created using DI as usual. Consider the possibility of defining steps/hooks using multiple objects.</li> </ol> <pre><code>CucumberLambda .using(GherkinPatch.class, ZukiniPatch.class) .step("A gherkin and a zukini", (gherkinPatch, zukiniPatch) -&gt; () -&gt; { // tend to the vegetable garden here }); </code></pre> <p><strong>Out of scope</strong></p> <ol start="4"><li>Generate localized vairations of the DSL that use Given/When/Then.</li> </ol> <pre><code> @Glue public static CucumberLambda glue = io.cucumber.lambda.en.CucumberLambda .using(World.class) .given("A gherkin and a zukini", (World world) -&gt; () -&gt; { world.setGherkins(1); world.setZukinis(1); }) .when("{int} gherkin(s) and {int} zukini(s)", (World world) -&gt; (int gherkins, int zukinis) -&gt; { world.setGherkins(gherkins); world.setZukinis(zukinis); }); // ect. </code></pre>
Assignees
<a href="https://github.com/mpkorstanje">@mpkorstanje</a>
Labels
‚ö° enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm">cucumber/cucumber-jvm</a>
Christian Hujer
2023-03-22 06:24:31

*Thread Reply:* Good points. Overall, annotations are quite inflexible anyway. They require everything to be known at compile-time. Which in this case may be fine. But I just wrote some withMockUser and withAnonymousUser functions for Kotlin to do security testing in Spring because I can't even combine @WithMockUser with @ParameterizedTest for roles, let alone use it in Cucumber. (Plus, without extra libraries, there is no easy workaround to simply instantiate them at runtime.)

mpkorstanje
2023-03-22 06:35:45

*Thread Reply:* You misunderstand. The point of the cucumber-java-lambda is to have everything known at compile time because it speeds up things significantly. cucumber-java8 registers steps at runtime.

Benjamin Bischoff
2023-12-04 06:27:35

Hello all, I just released Cucable v1.11.0 that allows easy customisation and selection of parallel scenarios. This new version allows to omit the runner generation as this is not needed in all use cases. https://github.com/trivago/cucable-plugin

üéâ mpkorstanje
mpkorstanje
2023-12-04 09:40:16

*Thread Reply:* You might be interested in knowing that Gradle also made a plugin that generates code:

https://github.com/gradle/cucumber-companion

gradle/cucumber-companion
Language
Groovy
Last updated
24 days ago
mpkorstanje
2023-12-04 09:42:37

*Thread Reply:* And since they submitted https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/pull/2823 I reckon you may want to do the same for Cucable as it would serve the same purpose (assuming I‚Äôm reading the support of JUnit 5 Suites correctly).

üòÆ Benjamin Bischoff
Benjamin Bischoff
2023-12-04 23:49:27

*Thread Reply:* The companion plugin generates JUnit 5 suites files whereas Cucable generates feature files that contain either one single scenario each or a specific suite of scenarios . So it is not only about the selection of tests but also "clustering" and parallelisation. It can create multiple runner classes from templates that run one of these feature files or multiple feature files. So the goal with Cucable was to have a dedicated, framework-independent way to pick and choose the exact test suites and parallelisation options you need. I will create a PR soon üôÇ

mpkorstanje
2023-12-08 10:41:03

*Thread Reply:* Okay. I think I misunderstood the plugin then. I figured it generated a runner per scenario (targeting the line the scenario is on), I didn't realize it would also rewrite the scenarios.

mpkorstanje
2023-12-08 10:41:10

*Thread Reply:* Still I can see how Cucable allows users to work around the lack of support for JUnit 5 in Maven by generating suite classes. But most examples use JUnit 4.

mpkorstanje
2023-12-08 10:42:33

*Thread Reply:* Do you think you could update the documentation to include how it works with JUnit 5?

I think most people would end up going in blank now.

mpkorstanje
2023-12-08 10:43:00

*Thread Reply:* The cucable docs I mean. üòÑ
